Teodora is 58 years old and lives in Barangay Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Philippines. She is married to a farmer with three children.
 
Teodora and her husband have a corn farm and earn approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan to buy farm inputs.
 
Teodora is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Teodora hopes to increase sales of their corn, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in the home.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 60 years old and lives in Gata Diot Clarin Mis. Occ. She is a widow with three adult-age children.

Ligaya has a snack-vending business. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for snacks vending.

Ligaya has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snacks vending

location.town: Ozamiz - Gata Diot Clarin Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 32 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is single without children. 
To earn a living, Jemma has a business selling fruits in the market. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Jemma has requested a loan to restock her store with a variety of fruits.

Jemma has been a member of PMPC for six months.  In the future, Jemma would like to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with a variety of fruits

loans.name: Mary Russel

texts.en: Mary Russel is a hardworking mother who is engaged in cooking and selling meals and snacks within the school campus. She is 23 years old and has one infant. Mary Russel plans to continue and improve the business by offering more kinds of recipes to her customers. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients and seasonings needed to cook and sell in the local community. She believes that her loan request will be granted to enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy needed raw ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel earns a living by selling barbeque, hanging rice, and salad in the market. She has been doing this for more than two years and was able to provide for the needs of the family. 

She used her previous loan from GDMPC in purchasing ingredients, and has successfully repaid the loan. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy raw ingredients to boost her business. 

She plans to improve her business in order to gain more income for a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food business.

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda. He trades in shoes, a business he started after assessing its lucrative nature in the area.

Like most parents, Anthony desires to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications and set up other sustainable income generating activities to secure their future.

High taxes and the seasonal nature of his business, which tends to be more profitable during festive seasons and decline in other months, pose a challenge to his growth. His dream is to diversify business to include cloth sales.

Anthony is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell. His target customers are school-going children.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell to school-going children.

loans.name: Gulbiby

texts.ru: Гулбиби молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1984 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети не совершеннолетние. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Гулбиби занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает скот дома. Гулбиби занимается этим бизнесом уже более 6 лет. Несколько месяцев назад приехал ее муж. Теперь он должен уехать в Российскую Федерацию, но не имеет денег. Гулбиби запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulbiby is a young and hardworking woman.  She was born in 1984.  She is married and raising 3 children.  Her children are not of age.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  Gulbiby is involved in animal husbandry.  She fattens up livestock at home.  Gulbiby has been involved in this business for over 6 years.  Her husband came home several months ago.  Now he has to go back to the Russian Federation, but does not have money.  Gulbiby is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to purchase an airline ticket.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for you mercy.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket for her husband to go to Russia

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em would like to request another loan to repair her stall in order to attract more customers to buy beverages. Em's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her beverage-selling stall.

loans.name: Johnah

texts.en: Johnah raises pigs for sale to aid her husband's income. She is earning well for the family and had successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used this loan in order to buy feeding supplies for the piggery. Recently, she borrowed a new loan, again from GDMPC microcredit, to buy feeding supplies and other supplies needed to boost her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and other supplies needed

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain, 56 years old, is a very well-known grocer from Iraq. He is married and has 2 children. Hussain works hard to provide his family's income on his own. In his grocery store, Hussain has a wide variety of goods, such as dairy products, canned food, drinks, shampoos and detergents, which he sells to his neighbors. He established his business in 2012 and has good experience in what he practices. 

Hussain is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy two new refrigerators, a freezer and more goods to add to his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators, a freezer and more goods to add to his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase work equipment such as: polisher, spoons, drill, hammer, and  water measurers.  He will also use the loan to pay of a $601.63 debt that he acquired from a bank and he believes the interest rate is too high.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Rose is widowed and has six children. She works as a community health worker and a primary teacher in school, as well as working on projects on her land. She grows maize, beans, amaranth, and sunflower, rears dairy goats and cows, and also keeps her own bees. Lastly, she does "green banking," which involves bulking up cereals during harvest when the price is low and selling them when the prices goes up. She likes beekeeping because it is easy compared to other types of farming, requires relatively little capital, and encourages conservation of the environment. 

This is Rose’s first loan, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to pay her children’s school fees and invest in agribusinesses. Her hope for the future is to see her children educated and enjoy gains from her self-employment.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase components, replacement parts and new video games.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard lives and works close to Sindo, in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. 

Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats, to ply their wares. 

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education and, as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Bernard is married, and has 12 children. He has retired from the position of local chief in the municipal government and now focuses on farming his land. He has been farming for 40 years and is currently growing sunflower, maize, sorghum, and beans and he has many acacia trees on his land that he tends to. 

Bernard sees beekeeping as a beneficial source of income for not only private individuals, but also institutions like schools and it can enable these organizations to financially support themselves. 

This is Bernard’s first loan and he plans to use the income to pay school fees for his children, establish tree nurseries, and to assist orphans and other vulnerable members of the community. 

His hope for the future is to have a wealthy family and to live in an educated community. Bernard thanks his Kiva lenders and encourages them to come and visit their borrowers on site.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 40 years old and lives in Gango Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-age children.

Gerlie has a peso net business. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase one unit of photocopy machine and computer.

Gerlie has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one unit of photocopy machine and computer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives and works close to Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few residents work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Joseph is married and has 20 children. He is a retired civil servant and currently farms his land. He is growing bananas, amaranth, maize, beans, and sunflower and also rears dairy goats and keeps bees of his own. 

This is Joseph’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay his children’s school fees as well as plant fruit trees, which will have the double benefit of providing him with another income source as well as providing more flowers for his bees to feed on. Joseph would like to thank his Kiva lenders and assures them “I will be faithful in my loan repayments and encourage my neighbors to take up beekeeping.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 59 years old. She is married and has five children. Two of her siblings are now working and three of them are still studying. She lives in Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Virgina has engaged in the nipa-weaving business for 25 years and earned a monthly income of PHP 3,500. She requested a new loan to redeem a parcel of nipa farm from a neighboring town. She is a responsible mother to her siblings and a good member in Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to redeem a parcel of nipa farm

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old, married to Judy and together they are blessed with a 12-year-old child.

He has a hotel in Naivasha where he has specialized in selling delicious soup. He has been in this business for 10 years and has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy cow heads for making soup. With anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to own the biggest soup hotel in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy cow heads for making soup.

loans.name: Kim Louie

texts.en:
Kim is a 29-year-old man from the town of Cortes, Bohol. He drives a motorcycle to transport passengers to remote areas not accessible with jeepneys and tricycles. He is asking for a loan so he can support his business and buy the necessary parts for his unit. His loan will be used to buy tires, gasoline and to pay for vulcanizing. He hopes that with the loan's help, he can further invest his profits with other businesses so he can better plan for his future.

His income helps provide food for himself and his parents.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline and pay for vulcanizing

loans.name: Angellina

texts.en:
Angellina is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She sells cereals in the market and she has been in business since 2010.

A good mother that she is, Angellina desires to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification even though she did not have a chance to attend school.

Weather changes and inadequate capital affect her business. Her desire is to acquire permanent business premises, as she currently has a market stall, and also to expand her business to new areas. Angellina will use the loan to buy cereals such as maize and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as maize and millet to sell.

loans.name: Zina

texts.ru: Зине 62 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают двух сыновей. У Зины - среднее образование, она старается быть всегда в хорошем впечатлении о жизни, очень позитивная. Знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зина занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 44 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 30 овец, а также имеет свой земельный надел, на котором выращивает сено и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления скота. Сено и корм для скота заготавливает со своего земельного надела, на сегодняшний день корм для скота заготовлен в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zina is 62 years old, married and has two children together with her husband. Zina has secondary education. She always strives to live life well and she is very positive. She knows exactly what she wants and applies all her strength towards it.

As a main income for her family, Zina works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 44 years ago with the purchase of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zina's persistent work, her farm currently has three dairy cows, one horse and 30 sheep. She also has her own plot of land, on which she grows hay and clover for livestock consumption. She harvests the hay and fodder for her livestock from her land allotment, and currently it is in sufficient quantities for her. The monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Zina turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows for increasing the number of livestock. Zina plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anito

texts.en: Anito has been operating his motorcycle transportation business for more than eleven years, earning enough to provide for his family. He was also able to successfully repay his previous loan. He had used that loan to buy tires for his business. Recently, Anito requested a new loan from GDMPC to repair an existing vehicle. He wants to improve the business to have a good source of income for his family, and is always looking for ways to better their living situation.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru:
Ганчина родилась и выросла в столице Таджикистана. Она студентка 4 – го курса   заочного отделения Таджикского Технического университета. Она учиться на договорной основе. Ганчина живет с матерью, сестрой и братом.  Мать у Ганчины домохозяйка, все трое детей в семье являются студентами. Отец Ганчины, который жил от них отдельно, но всегда морально и материально поддерживал семью, к сожалению, скончался в 2012 году. Ганчина с сестрой начали работать параллельно с учебой, так как оба учатся на заочном отделении. Ганчина работает в организации, которая является одной из   лидирующих цехов по производству мороженого, тортов и более 20 видов кондитерских изделий. Она работает в должности мастера по изготовлению мороженного и тортов. 
Также Ганчина  после работы ходить на курсы английского языка более года, так как она считает что, в дальнейшем с ее выбранной профессией без английского языка ей будет очень тяжело найти себя в обществе. Данный момент Ганчина должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ganjina was born and grew up in the capital of Tajikistan. She is a fourth year student in the correspondence department of the Tajik Technical University. She pays for her studies. Ganjina lives with her mother, sister and brother. Ganjina's mother is a housewife, and the three children are all students. Ganjina's father, who lived separately from them but always supported the family morally and materially, unfortunately died in 2012.

Ganjina and her sister started working in parallel with the studies, as they both have to pay for their studies. Ganjina works for a company which is one of the leading producers of ice cream, cakes and more than 20 types of confectionery. She works as an overseer of the production of ice cream and cakes. After work, Ganjina has been going to an English course for more than a year, as she thinks it will be difficult for her to find a place in her chosen profession in the future without knowing English.

Currently Ganjina needs to pay for tuition, but she does not have enough money. She requests a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah  is widowed with five children and two of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling Vaseline.  She sells charcoal from home. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Laura Alejandra

texts.es:
La joven Laura Alejandra de 16 años , estudia en campo alto un técnico judicial y cursa actualmente 2 semestre, ha sido una experiencia maravillosa para ella y la madre  Jenny que es el motor de la vida de ella, ella desea ingresar como oficial del ejército colombiano porque se ha dado cuenta de que en Colombia prima más la guerra que la libertad y la paz , además dice que ella quiere estar en labor social, es decir ayudar a los niños más necesitados y que se encuentran en territorios de conflicto armado.

El técnico judicial es primordial para Laura porque es un paso muy importante para llegar a cumplir el sueño que tiene, le apasiona y le va muy bien en derecho penal y constitucional ,dos materias que ve en campo alto,además Laura tiene otro técnico, ya que estudio mercadeo y ventas en la institución técnica Nazaret convenio Sena , ella dice que campo alto es un lugar acogedor porque los estudiantes salen adelante, tienen un futuro prometedor porque tiene diferentes opciones de programas y sobre todo abre un gran camino hacia el futuro laboral.

La mama es la persona que la ha apoyado en toda la vida, le dice que el estudio es más importante que cualquier cosa porque sin eso no se llega a nada , Laura está muy feliz porque ya entro a grado once y pronto culminara una gran etapa , se prepara para el gran sueño, quiere estudiar inglés y sacar la licencia de conducción, culminar el técnico judicial , añora pensionarse del ejército , tener una estabilidad económica, quiere tener en el futuro una fundación para niños con escasos recursos y madres cabeza de familia , ama los animales,  anhela  brindarle a la madre todo lo que merece, esta joven  es una persona perseverante que le gusta el estudio, obtiene muy buenas notas y tiene un gran carácter y personalidad, con esfuerzo y amor por lo que quiere obtendrá los mejores resultados . 

Para ella nada es un obstáculo esta agradecida por todas las bendiciones que tiene y que gracias a ello, lograra ser una persona exitosa, con kiva ella podría terminar esta escala para poder cumplir el sueño de ella de entrar a la policía.
texts.en:
Laura Alejandra is 16 years old and is taking a Legal program at CampoAlto. She is in her second semester and it has been a marvelous experience for her and her mother, Jenny, who is the engine of her life. She would like to be an officer of the Colombian army because she has realized that in Colombia they value war more than freedom and peace.  She also states that she would like to do social work so she can help needy children in regions where there is armed conflict. Earning a Legal certificate is essential for Laura because it is an important step in realizing her dream. She is passionate about and is doing very well at criminal and constitutional law, two subjects that are covered at CampoAlto. In addition, Laura has another certificate in Marketing and Sales which she earned at Nazaret Technical Institute under SENA. She says that CampoAlto is a welcoming place because the students progress and have a promising future. There are many program options but most of all it opens up a big pathway to the future labor market. 

Her mother is the one who supported her throughout her life and has told her that getting an education is more important than anything else because without that you can not accomplish anything. Laura is very happy because she has started 11th grade and will soon complete an important step. She is preparing for her big dream - she wants to study English, get her driver's license, and finish her Legal certificate. She dreams of retiring from the army and having financial stability.  In the future she hopes to have a foundation for children with limited resources and from families with mothers as the head of household.  She loves animals.  She dreams of providing her mother with everything she deserves. 

This young lady is a hard-working person who likes to study, gets good grades and has a great character and personality, and with effort and love she will come out ahead. Nothing is an obstacle for her.  She is grateful for all her blessings and thanks to that she will be successful.  Kiva will allow her to finish this step on her way to achieving her dream of entering the police force.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester.

loans.name: Sreyra's Group

texts.en: A local citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sreyra is 20 years old and a mother blessed with one son. To cover the necessary expenses in her household, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland and works for others for a fee. She has been in business for six years. This is not the first loan for Sreyra with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past two loans which she has repaid completely enabled her to uplift her lifestyle. Now, she is leading the group of two to get a new loan of 800,000 KHR each. For Sreyra, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes to collect her yield on time with a good selling price in return.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en: Sakun, in her mid-50s, is a villager from Dambae district in the Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of two children. To sustain her family, she sells grocery items and grows cassava as the main sources of income. She has been in business for more than 20 years.  Sakun, a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid her past loans and they have helped her to upgrade her living conditions. She is taking out a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy grocery items for resell and to buy fertilizer for her cassava crop. Additionally, she will spend some portion of her loan to buy piglets to raise as supplemental income. She hopes to gain a good income from her business so that she can keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for resell, and fertilizer and piglets for her farm.

loans.name: Johanes

texts.en:
Johanes is married and has seven children. Johanes works as a pastor and a farmer, while his wife farms their land full-time. They have been farming for thirty-five years, and are currently growing maize, sorghum, beans, soy, amaranth, bananas, and sunflowers on their land. Johanes is excited to start beekeeping because he will have honey (which he will use to cure his children’s coughs) as well as income to improve his housing. 

This is Johanes’ first loan, and he plans to use the income to cover his children’s school fees, as well as basic family needs. In the future, Johanes hopes that his children “will take up beekeeping as a project for income [rather] than end up in things like crime.” He would like to thank his Kiva lenders and asks if he can be in touch with them for further advice. 

Johanes lives and works near Sindo, in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jorge Iván Blandón

texts.es:
Jorge, a sus 47 años de edad, se ha ganado la vida como herrero, labor que aprendió hace aproximadamente 35 años, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y un tío, y que ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos; la herradura que produce la vende a un distribuidor mayorista del municipio, logrando generar los recursos económicos para llevar el sustento al hogar y velar por el bienestar de sus dos hijos. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor (varilla, lámina y carbón), así podrá tener disponibilidad inmediata para cumplir con los pedidos y así mejorar sus ventas. 
Jorge manifiesta que su anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y, espera lograr que perdure en el tiempo, para dejar un buen legado a sus hijos y que éstos puedan tener un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en: George, at 47 years of age, has made his living as a blacksmith, a profession which he learned approximately 35 years ago, thanks to his father and uncle, and that has now become his principle source of income. He sells the horseshoes that he produces from a wholesale distributor of the municipality, managing to generate the economic resources to bring home and look after the welfare of his two sons. He is currently requesting the support of a loan to buy raw material in bulk (rods, plates, and coal), so that he may have immediate availability to fulfill orders as well as improve sales. Jorge says that his wish is to expand his business and create new work opportunities and that he hopes that it will last over time so that he may leave a good legacy for his children and that they may have a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: buy raw material in bulk (rods, plates, and coal)

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis es un campesino de 37 años de edad, nació en una familia humilde y trabajadora, sus padres y hermanos mayores le enseñaron todas las labores del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee sus propias tierras con cultivos de fríjol, maíz, cebolla de rama y aguacate; cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del municipio donde reside; de esta forma genera los ingresos suficientes para su familia. 
El cliente manifiesta que su mayor desafío es luchar contra las inclemencias del clima que afectan sus cultivos y de los altos costos de los insumos que requiere; es por ello que solicitó crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (pesticidas, abonos, larvicidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), así podrá seguir cuidando sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva, con alimentos de excelente calidad; así podrá mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que recibe por su ardua labor.
Luis, como todo hombre soñador y trabajador, desea que su negocio prospere y sea rentable, para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y así poder disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a 37-year-old farmer who was born to a humble and hardworking family. His parents and older brothers taught him all the farm work and, thanks to them, today he owns his own land with crops of beans, corn, green onions, and avocado whose harvests are collected and sold in the market of the municipality in which he resides. In this way he generates sufficient income for his family. 

The client says that his biggest challenge is combating inclement weather that affects his crops and the high costs of the supplies that he needs; it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan, in order to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies in bulk (pesticides, composts, larvicides, fertilizers, etc.), so that he may continue tending to his crops and receive a much more productive harvest with excellent quality food, and so that he may improve his sales and the income that he receives for his hard work. 

Luis, like every hardworking man with dreams, wishes for his business to thrive and be profitable, so that favorable economic stability is guaranteed and so that he may enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies in bulk (pesticides, composts, larvicides, fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos es un campesino de 46 años de edad, que desde que era joven su padre le enseñó todas las labores del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de aguacate, fríjol y arveja, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del pueblo, adicionalmente posee ganado de levante para comercializar, lo que le genera un ingreso adicional a la familia.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (larvicidas, pesticidas, fungicidas, entre otros), que son necesarios para que le permitan reabonar la tierra y así obtener una cosecha  mucho más productiva, para generar mejores ingresos para su hogar. 
Su mayor anhelo, es hacer que su negocio crezca y ampliar su cultivo de  aguacates, pues cuenta con el espacio necesario; además desea que este le permita generar mejores ingresos y así poder disfrutar de su hija.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 46-year-old farmer. Since he was young, his father taught him all about farm work and, as a result, he has avocado, bean, and pea crops today. His crops are harvested and sold in the village market square. He also raises cattle for the market which generates an additional income for the family. 
He is currently seeking the support of a loan to purchase agricultural inputs in bulk (larvicides, pesticides, fungicides, and more) which are necessary because they allow the land to replenish its fertility to obtain a more productive crop to generate more income for his home.
His greatest desire is to make his business grow and expand his avocado crop so that he has enough space to allow better income for his daughter to enjoy.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale agricultural inputs including larvicides, pesticides, and fungicides.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is single with no children and takes care of her father. She has a business selling cabbage and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cabbage. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land to start growing cabbage. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more cabbage .

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Pom, a resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 33 years old and a mother of two kids. To support her family, she plants cassava and rubber trees (her main source of income), with support from her husband. These businesses have returned her about 27,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles with successful repayment. The positive impact of her past loan has helped her family achieve a better living condition as well as to stabilize their living conditions.  Now, she is seeking a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to renovate her house. She hopes to own a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in Qarakert village in the Armavir region with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Samvel is a farmer with many years of experience running a farm. He keeps piglets, pigs and a cow. Due to his hard and tireless work during recent years, Samvel was able to run his farm in a sustainable way, ensuring a stable income for his family. Now, by applying for this loan, Samvel would like to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Samvel's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Samvel hopes for the lenders' support and is sure that this loan will be a good help in the development of his farm.

loans.use: to buy a calf and forage to feed the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en: Sreang a 43 year-old widow, is a villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To  support the entire household, she does rice farming and works for others for a fee to earn more income. Sreang, who is in her fifth cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for reaping of her crop. She believes that she can earn more income from her business so that she can better her living condition.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Margelina

texts.en:
Margelina is 63-years-old and has three children. She is married and has one child in school.

Margelina is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her chickens.

Margelina has been in the poultry business for three years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her chickens

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 50-years-old and married with three children who are in school.  Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ellen has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase chairs and mirrors needed for a hair cutting & styling station, a washing station, coloring and hair styling supplies, professional curling equipment, and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay county, which is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Maria is married, and has ten children. Both she and her husband have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing maize, beans, soy, amaranth, and sunflower. She likes beekeeping because it is a "low-labour" business that still provides good returns. 

This is Maria’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay school fees and increase sunflower farming. Her dream for the future is to save enough to make improvements to her house. She would like to thank Kiva lenders “for this loan which is not like other loans. It suits us well. Hope to be in touch with them some day.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jaime Humberto

texts.es:
Jaime, a sus 59 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 20 años. Se ha dedicado al comercio de manera independiente desde hace aproximadamente 25 años; inició con una panadería en la que trabaja con su esposa diariamente de 2:00 am a 7:00 pm y, poco a poco fue creciendo y le permitió adaptar el espacio para incursionar con un restaurante; de esta forma logra generar los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito, pues desea comprar un asador de pollos grande y surtido al por mayor (harina, pollo, carnes, verduras, gaseosas, frutas, entre otros), con lo que podrá cumplir su deseo de ampliar su menú en el restaurante, lo que le permitirá satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus comensales y podrá aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
Jaime manifiesta que su principal objetivo es sacar adelante su negocio, lograr que perdure en el tiempo para dejar un buen legado a su hijo y así pueda conservar la tradición; para que su futuro sea más próspero y logre tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime, 59 years old, is married and the father of a 20 year old son. He has been an independent businessman for approximately 25 years. He started with a bakery where he worked with his wife daily from 2 a.m. to 7 p.m. Little by little his business grew and he was able to adapt the space into a restaurant. In this way he generated sufficient resources to support his family.

Currently, Jaime is requesting a loan to purchase a rotisserie for large chickens and supplies (flour, chickens, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, fruit and other items) wholesale so that he can meet his goal of expanding his restaurant’s menu. This will enable him to satisfy the diverse tastes of his diners and increase his sales and earnings.

Jaime states that his principal objective is for his business to be a lasting success that allows him to leave a good legacy to his son and thereby preserve a tradition so that his future will be more prosperous and he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a rotisserie for large chickens and supplies (flour, chickens, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, fruit and other items) wholesale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has eleven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty-five years now, and they are currently growing sunflower, cassava, maize, sorghum, cow peas, and sweet potatoes in their farm. Peter looks forward to beekeeping as it is an enterprise that is easy to manage and it will generate him extra income.

This is Peter’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care as its loan product is affordable for small scale farmers. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay for his children’s school fees and to provide for their basic needs. Peter’s hope for the future is “to be a good honey producer, even better than those from eastern Kenya.”

Peter lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Patricia Yanet

texts.es:
Patricia, a sus 33 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente desde hace aproximadamente 1 año, vende mercancía en general como ropa, perfumería, ropa interior entre otros, sus principales clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos. Alterna su labor trabajando por días en un almacén y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar toda la carga económica de su familia, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo financiero del padre de sus dos hijos, después de la dolorosa separación. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (jeans, blusas, perfumería, ropa interior, accesorios de bisutería, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada decembrina, generándole un mayor nivel de ingresos. 
Patricia manifiesta que su meta principal es montar su propio almacén en un local comercial, para así trabajar de manera más cómoda y ampliar su clientela; esto le garantizará una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro más próspero para sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 33 years old, Patricia has made a living working as an independent saleswoman for about one year. She sells general merchandise like clothing, perfumes, and underwear, among other things. Her main customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends. She alternates this with working at a store. In this way she makes enough to support her family's finances by herself as she has no financial support from the father of her children after their painful separation.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale merchandise (jeans, blouses, perfumes, underwear, and jewelry accessories, among others). With this she will be able to have enough supply to satisfy the increased demand during the December season and will make a better income.

Patricia states that her main goal is to start her own store in a commercial location so that she can work more comfortably and increase her clientele. This will guarantee her a better quality of life and a more prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise like jeans, blouses, perfumes, underwear, and jewelry accessories, among others.

loans.name: Rinad Group

texts.en:
This group, called Rinad, consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. All hardworking women, they have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Bushra is the leader of this group. A married mother of five children, she owns a small house. She started by buying a small piece of land, something that took great effort to achieve. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to use for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Al-Zahowr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Zahowr. This group consists of five ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 300,000 YER. Anhar is a 52-year-old married woman and has five children. She wants to help her husband and provide better living conditions for her family. She has a business selling ladies' clothes and perfumes. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. 

The loan of 80,000 YER from AMB she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying ladies' clothes and perfumes. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes and perfumes to expand her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina tiene 22 años y tiene un hijito de un año,  ella se dedica a la actividad de confección  de variedad de chamarras tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Palermo,  este es su primer crédito con la institución la señora Marina va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una máquina de coser  over para realizar un mejor trabajo ya que la que tiene le está presentando algunas fallas, y el joven tiene muchos pedidos que tiene que entregar ya que por estas fechas tiene mucha demanda, la señora Marina es una persona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir delante de mejorar  su calidad de vida y con el tiempo poder ofrecer sus productos a distintos mercados del interior del país como a distintas ferias.
texts.en:
Marina is 22 years old, is married, and has a 1-year-old son. She makes a variety of jackets in her own shop located in the Palermo zone. This is her 1st loan with our institution. Marina will use this loan to purchase a special sewing machine to do better work, since the one she has now makes some errors and the young woman has lots of orders to complete, as the present season is a busy one.

Marina is a hard-working person who wants to forge ahead and improve her quality of life. In time, she wishes to offer her products in at certain markets in the interior of the country at distinct fairs.

loans.use: to buy a straight-line sewing machine for clothes making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to his stock of metal sheets and bars for making doors, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Janet has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a business selling herbal medicines in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Elma is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Elma hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and works hard to support her family. Marites has had an herbal medicine business for seven years in the Philippines.

Marites has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old and married with seven children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for two years and also earns an income from a general store and farming sugarcane.

Margarita aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk and flour for her food vending business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a selection of clothes at wholesale (blouses, jackets, jeans, and shirts, among other items) to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
For eight years Mylene, a hardworking 32-year-old single woman, has been running a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, etc. She has requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of these goods to sell.

In the future, Mylene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, deteregent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 29 years old and a single mother of two beautiful children who are in school.

She has a salon business in Naivasha that she has been running for one year and she has applied for first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a dryer and other salon items. 

She will use the anticipated profit from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest salon in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a dryer and other salon items

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

Maximina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Maximina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Maximina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 70 años de edad,  es acompañado, la esposa posee una tienda, en donde pasa vendiendo, sus hijos ya no viven en casa, tienen su propia familia, con él vive una hija de crianza y dos nietas, pero de él solo depende la esposa, aunque ella tiene su propio negocio.

Miguel no recuerda exactamente, el tiempo que tiene de dedicarse propiamente al servicio de mecánica, porque lo hace de pequeño, lo aprendió de sus padres y le gusto por lo que sigue trabajando en lo mismo, también hace trabajos de estructuras metálicas, como hacer puertas, ventanas, poner techos en viviendas, etc. el trabajo lo hace en su casa y  busca personas para que le ayuden, lo hace sin pensar en tiempo, porque cree que el hecho que lo busquen a trabajar es una bendición. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para arreglar los papeles de un vehículo, debido a que lo compro y la persona que era antes dueña falleció, por lo que se le ha hecho difícil, por el gasto en el que incurrirá y actualmente le costaría reunir el dinero, el crédito le ayudara a mejorar debido a que genere mejores ingresos pues en ocasiones lo han buscado para hacer algunos viajes de leña o otro tipo de materiales y no lo ha hecho por miedo a que se lo decomisen las autoridades.

Con el negocio piensa seguir trabajando igual, trabajando para el sustento diario y quiere que si un día le falta la vida no dejarles problemas más grandes por el vehículo a sus hijos. Con el préstamo, lograra solucionar el problema de los papeles, las ganancias del crédito las utilizara para pagar una cuota de un crédito de una de sus hijas que viajo a los estados unidos, la cual no le ayudo a pagarlo estando alla.
texts.en:
Miguel is 70 years old and has a spouse.  His wife has a store where she spends her time selling.  Their children don't live at home anymore as they have their own families. A foster child and two granddaughters live with him, but only his wife is dependent on him even though she has her own business. Miguel doesn't remember exactly how long he has been working as a mechanic because he has been doing it since he was young.  He learned the skill from his parents, liked it and stayed with it. He also works on metal structures such as making doors, windows, putting roofs on houses, etc. He does the work from home and looks for people to help him. He is never concerned about the time he spends because he thinks it is blessing enough that people seek his services. 

The loan he is requesting is to take care of the paperwork for a vehicle, which, due to the fact that the previous owner passed away, is causing difficulties and incurring expenses. It is hard for him to scrape together the money he needs at this time.  The loan will help him to increase his income and improve his finances; on occasion he has been asked to transport wood or other kinds of materials but he hasn't done it for fear that the authorities will confiscate the vehicle. He plans on continuing with his business as before, working to meet his daily needs. He wants to resolve the issue with the vehicle so that if one day he loses his life he won't be leaving bigger problems for his children. With the loan he will be able to solve the problem with the paperwork and he will use the extra money to make a payment on a loan taken out by one of his daughters who traveled to the US and who has not helped with the payments since she has been there.

loans.use: to take care of the paperwork for a vehicle, due to the fact that he bought it and then the previous owner passed away

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old and married with eight children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock items like coffee, milk and sugar to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock items like coffee, milk and sugar to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 35-year-old single mother of two beautiful children, aged 16 and 10. For the past two years, she has operated a money transfer business and sold phone accessories in Naivasha. Susan has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy an M-PESA float for her business. She will use the anticipated profit from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. In the near future, Susan hopes to own the biggest money transfer business in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a float for M-PESA

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 46 years old and has ten children. She is married and seven children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

She has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 52-year-old married man. He and his wife Catherine are blessed with three children ages 12, 6, and 4 years old.

He is in a farming business, which he has practiced for 25 years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his farming business and to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to be among the top farmers in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Bernadine

texts.en:
Bernadine is 57-years-old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bernadine has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Bernadine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 29, is a villager from Dambae district in Kampong Cham province. She has two kids who still count on her as they are still in school. To fulfill the basic needs of her family, she sells grocery items and plants cassava as the main source of income. The current business that she has been with for a few years has returned her around 188,000 KHR per day. With this new loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely managed her past loans with success to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy rubber tree seedlings and to pay for labor fees for her cassava and rubber tree fields. She hopes to expand her business on a bigger scale so that she can make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rubber tree seedlings and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb is a borrower from the Cheung Prey district of Kompong Cham province. She is 43 years old and a married mother with two kids. To support her family, she and her husband do rice cropping as their main income and work for others for a fee for supplementary income. Currently, she is able to earn about 29,000 KHR per day. Chreb, a second-time borrower, joined a group of two with a first time borrower of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to get a new loan. The past loan, which she has repaid, has helped her to uplift her lifestyle. She is now seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 100,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay reaping (harvesting) fees. She hopes to earn a good income from her business to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet, 40 years old, is a single woman with 2 children. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX to pay tuition for her daughter. Annet has a challenge of little stock from her banana plantation, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to pay school fees. She is hardworking and committed to see her children through school. Annet appears on the right of the photo, with a Ugafode staff member.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay county, which is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. (Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often includes traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.) 

Eunice is widowed, and has six children. She runs a small kiosk in town and sells fish in the market, as well as farming her land. She has been farming for sixteen years, and is currently growing beans, maize, amaranth, sunflower, and cassava. She also rears goats and cows. She likes beekeeping because honey is medicinal, and it encourages people to conserve the environment by planting trees and not clear-cutting. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to pay school fees for her children, expand her business, and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papayas and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Eliud is married and has 10 children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 38 years. Currently they are currently growing maize, sorghum, sunflower and fruits on their farm. Eliud is looking forward to beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating his farm and the honey produced will be a source of medicine for his family.

This is Eliud’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to start a small business. Eliud’s hope for the future is to be a successful beekeeper.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Al-Anwar Group

texts.en:
Al-Anwar is a four-member group. All of them are poor ladies from Sana`a, Yemen. Together they applied for a 270,000 YER loan from AMB. 

Hayah is a 35-year-old married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Sana`a. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she needs more money. In order to complete the renovation, she asked for a loan of 80,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks for her house.

loans.name: Rimass Group

texts.en:
This group of four hard-working women is called Rimass. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. Together they have applied for a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Aisha is a 51-year-old married woman living in a poor area of Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house. 

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno was born in the year 1967. She is a teacher in a school. Barno has a higher pedagogical education. She has worked for many years in a school, so she has great experience. Her husband works in a shaft. She lives poorly with her family. She has a small salary. 

Barno must buy food items and winter clothes for her children, but she does not have money. She is asking for a loan of TJS 3,000 (somoni) to buy food items and winter clothes for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items and winter clothes for her children.

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
Daina is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (mother). She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying for electricity bills. She has a business of selling cosmetics and has been in this business for four years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics. She generates additional from hiring out boys to do a mobile salon business. She sells on a retail basis and sells six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more boxes  of cosmetics.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food stall business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for the fried chicken that she sells to customers.

Jessica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Jessica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the fried chicken that she sells to customers.

loans.name: Marines

texts.en:
Marines is aged 30. She and her partner in life did not yet marry, but they are blessed with two children. Marines has been a vegetable vendor in their public market for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her daily profits are spent on their children's school allowance and the other are spent on their daily expenditures. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase vegetables to sell, such as eggplant, string beans, cabbage, and squash. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell, such as eggplant, string beans, cabbage, and squash.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old and married. They have three children who are aged between 22 and 3 years old.

Agnes is a farmer. She has been in it for many years and has applied for her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya. She is planning to use the money to buy fertilizers and seedlings, which will actually improve her produce.

She hopes to get a bigger loan in the near future that will help boost her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 48 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She's been into selling shoes for almost ten years and earning a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her daily profits are usually spent on school allowances for her children and their daily expenditures. Due to inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable and will improve.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah, 27 years old, is married to Francis and they are blessed with one child. Hannah has been running a retail shop and money transfer business in Naivasha for three years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy buckets, thermoses, dishes and other kitchen utensils. Hannah will use the anticipated profit from her expanded business to further expand it. In the near future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy buckets, thermoses, dishes and other kitchen utensils

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 49 years old, from Nyandarua South, and married to Salome. They have three children who are aged between 17 and 13 years old. 

Stephen is a farmer and has been in ii for many years. He has applied for his fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to expand his farm business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm

loans.name: María Justina

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar  que se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Nuestra amiga es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una lancha en la cual se dedica a la pesca, el junto a sus hijos se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca,  se van por tres a cuatro días a realizar sus labores, ellos andan junto a un barco pesquero al cual le entregan todas las tardes el producto de la pesca del día, una vez transcurrido estos días ellos regresan a sus hogares para así después de varios días regresar a sus faenas en el mar, a pesar que es un trabajo duro es la única forma que ellos conocen para sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Lleva 7 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que nunca les pase nada en alta mar.
texts.en:
The small loan group “Virgen Del Mar” meets every 15 days in the beautiful spa of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited by national and international tourists throughout the year. In this area, the majority of the inhabitants work in fishing and maritime activities.

María lives in this area. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are of age but still live at home. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Our friend is a wonderful homemaker who is taking out the loan so that her husband can use it in his work. He has a boat that he uses for fishing. He goes out to sea with his sons in their small boat to fish. They go out for three or four days. They go out with a larger fishing boat to which they turn in their daily catch. After fishing for a few days, they return home for a few days and then return to sea. Though it is a hard job, it is the only way they know to support their families.

This loan is to buy nets, string, fuel, and food for the days when they have to be at sea. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and she likes it because they always provide her with the loans. Her dream is that nothing will happen to them while they’re at sea.

loans.use: to buy nets, string, fuel, and food .

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 31-year-old married man. He describes himself as committed. Joel operates a business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and his business is located in a strategic place. Joel describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy spare parts. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bicycle spare parts. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Pacita requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency.

Pacita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Komisah

texts.en:
Komisah is a housewife living with four persons in the family home in Bandung. Bandung is a major city in West Java, located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. Komisah is married and has two children. Komisah is running a small stall that sells medicine and mobile phone airtime credits, and services bill payments.
 
She felt interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to expand her business. She is glad that her business was assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last month, she has had around $30-$40 per day sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities. Komisah thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives in Mastara village with his family. He is the father of two school-aged children. Gevorg and his wife have been involved in agriculture. They keep livestock (sheep, chickens, cows and calves) and cultivate wheat and barley. The family's only source of income comes from farming, so Gevorg works hard to gather a good harvest and a high income. 

Gevorg has requested this loan to be able to increase his livestock and enlarge his farm. The loan will help him to purchase 5 piglets, 2 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This will increase his agricultural income and allow Gevorg to provide a better life for his family. 

As this is Gevorg's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Gevorg relies on lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for 5 piglets, 2 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 35, is a widowed mother of five children, residing in the Kean Svay district of Kandal province. Presently, only four of her children are under her responsibility and two of them are studying in the university. To struggle for a living, she sells grocery items as her only source of income. This is the second microloan for Sarum with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the successful repayment of her past loan, she has managed to keep her kids in school. Now, she is applying for an education loan to cover the tuition fees for her son to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in agricultural science. She hopes her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a repeat borrower aged 46 years old. He is a married man with nine children, and he applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to improve his pineapple farming business. He has a challenge of low output from his pineapples, so he wants to use the money to buy mulch and hire labour to work on his farm. He hopes this will improve his productivity. He is hardworking. In the photo is Henry, his wife, and the UGAFODE staff (from left to right).

loans.use: to buy mulch

loans.name: Cinta

texts.en: Cinta is a housewife living with three people in the family home in Bandung. Bandung is a major city in West Java, located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. Cinta runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits, and servicing bill payments. She joined Ruma because she wanted to expand her business. She is glad that her business was assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has had around $25-$26 per day sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall.
