In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities. In the photo, Cinta is standing in front of her small stall. Cinta thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Henelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Henelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a  business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Henelyn is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Henelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 54-years-old and has one child who is still in school.

Myrna has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for six years. Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Chhoey Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Nak is 27-years-old and married. She has one kid who is still small. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs for three years. The current business earns her family about 43,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

This is Nak’s first micro loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,500,000 KHR to buy more piglets and pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to fulfill her dream of growing rice in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, eggs, etc.

Michelle has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Michelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Gulayim

texts.ru: Гулайим 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Гулайим - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулайим занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 27 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулайим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 15 овец, 10 коз, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,32 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, подсолнух. Также есть небольшой сад с яблонями, который дает хороший урожай. На данный момент у нее в подвале собраны 3 тонны яблок для продажи, продавать будет перед Новым Годом, так как будет хороший спрос и высокие цены на фрукты. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайим обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Гулайим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulayim is 58 years old, married, and, with her husband, raising one daughter. Gulayim has a secondary education. Tor provide the primary source of income for her family, Gulayim farms and keeps livestock. She started 27 years ago when she bought cattle with 10,000 KGS.  Because of Gulayim's hard work, her farm now has five dairy cows, fifteen sheep, ten goats, and also a 0.32 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes, corn, and sunflowers. Also there is a small orchard with apple trees, which produces a good harvest. Right now, she has three tons of apples in her cellar which she will sell before the New Year, since then there will be strong demand and high prices for fruit. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Gulayim approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cattle for fattening and resale. Gulayim plans to invest profits she nets from the loan in to further expanding her livestock.

loans.use: buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Narcisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

Narcisa would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 50-years-old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Mercy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercy has been farming vegetables for eight years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Using her own working capital, one year ago Josefa, a married mother of two, began operating a business in front of her house selling  shoes, children's clothing, socks, hand wipes and slippers. Living near the town's main road, Josefa sells every day to passersby. She also has animals such as horses, buffalo, pigs and chickens.

Josfea has requested this loan of $1500 to purchase more merchandise to improve her business and her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy shoes, children's clothing, socks, hand wipes and slippers

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is taking a loan of 1,200 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as rice, vegetables, chicken, pork, plates and spoons.  She opened her food stall a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, chicken, pork, plates and spoons.

loans.name: Spark Group

texts.en:
Manjorie is the featured borrower of Spark Group. They requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which they will use to support their families in their hometown Philippine with the necessary living needs.

Manjorie is 37 years old, single, and has two children. She works as a housekeeper to financially support her children. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, which she will use to send to her beloved family back in Philippine to cover their needs and make sure that they will be capable of making sure that her children will have a delightful Christmas celebrations.
Manjorie is the first from the left, Annablelle is at the center, and Maluz is the first from the right.

loans.use: to send the money to her children so they can celebrate Christmas

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn, 22 years of age, is married to a driver and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost seven years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase sugar, noodles, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, noodles, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 47 лет. Она разведена и имеет одного ребенка. После развода с мужем все заботы семьи перешли на нее. Она сама вырастила своего ребенка. Замира жила вместе со своими родителями. После смерти родителей, она начала свой бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она уже более 8 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Замира хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и увеличить доход, так как ее бизнес является основным источником ее семьи. Замира запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zamira is 47 years old. She is divorced and has one child. After her divorce, she took on all family's worries. She raised her child. Zamira lived with her parents. After his parents died, she started her business selling dried fruit. She has been in this business for more than eight years. Zamira wants to increase her working capital and increase her revenue, this business is the family's main source of income. Zamira is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: buy dried fruit for resale

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANOU ont en moyenne 40 ans,5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des légumes, des condiments, des  poissons et de la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANOU sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire. ADIARATOU 2 eme femme à la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150kg de poissons fumés auprès des pêcheurs. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the KANOU group are on average 40 years old, have 5 children each, and all live in large traditional families in the town of Bla in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through parental ties and run their businesses buying and selling vegetables, sauces, fish and restaurant food. After having properly repaid their previous loan, the women of the KANOU group are on their second group loan. Adiaratou, the second woman to the right of the photo, expects to use her loan to buy 150 kg of smoked fish from the fishermen. She stocks up in Bla. She makes her sales to a clientele made up of women and men, for cash and often for credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 f CFA which will be used for the relative expenses of food and school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a lady who is 37 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. She is a crop farmer in Kimende, which is on the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in this business for five years now and earns a monthly income of 14,000 KES.

This will be Rachael's fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings. In the future,  she wants to educate her children and also be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is age 56 and single. She manages a direct selling business where she has sold personal use products for almost three years. In this business, she earns a net income of PHP 1,000 monthly. Due to insufficient capital, she would like a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to purchase perfume, lingerie, deodorant and talcum powder to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase perfume, lingerie, deodorant and talcum powder to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 41 years old and married to James. They are blessed with two children who are 16 and 13 years old respectively. She runs a private school and has been in this business for nine years. 

Lucia plans to use this loan to purchase textbooks for the school. She will also use part of the amount for renovation purposes. She will use the generated income to expand the school by building more classes. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, Lucia hopes to build a bigger school and purchase a school bus.

loans.use: To buy textbooks and renovate the school.

loans.name: Plimus

texts.en:
Plimus is an old client.  Aged 45 years, he is a married man with five children. 

He applied for a loan of 300,000 KES to do finishing on his family house which he has  built out of his income from agriculture together with the previous loan. He wants to finish and live in a comfortable home.

He is a resilient man who loves his family and works hard to attain the best for them. Pictured is Plimus (centre), his wife, and the UGAFODE staff member at the house to be finished.

loans.use: To finish his residential house

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a 42 year old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be stable. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of cereals

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 31-year-old single woman with two children. She describes herself to be stable. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of fabric, threads and materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of fabric, thread and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has two children who are in school. Nerissa is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a barbershop business in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like scissors, combs, etc. for her business.

Nerissa has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like scissors, combs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Juvy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling nipa roofing. Juvy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to resell at her store, like rice, snack foods and seasonings. 

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirteen loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell at her store like rice, snack foods and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase parts for her agricultural machine that have been damaged from wear and tear through the years

loans.name: Ntwari Group

texts.fr:
Justine fait partie du groupe Ntwari et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 51 ans et est mariée à Alphonse,  un pêcheur. Ensemble ils ont  10 enfants, âgés de 10 à 32 ans, dont 5 étudient, et dont 5 sont dans leurs foyers. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane  depuis  10 ans.

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour la production de la bière de banane  à  revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle  voudrait construire une belle maison en matériaux durables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Justine is part of the Ntwari group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 51 years old and is married to Alphonse, a fisherman. Together, they have 10 children ranging in age from 10 to 32 years old, five of whom are in school and five in their own homes. She has sold banana beer for 10 years. She is on her third loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas in order to produce banana beer and resell it for a profit. In the coming years, she would like to build a beautiful house out of durable materials and to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for the production of banana beer to be sold at a profit.

loans.name: Rocilyn

texts.en:
Rocilyn, a 49-year-old married mother of 10, has been earning a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines for 15 years. She earns additional income by buying and selling rice.

Rocilyn is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Дамиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Дамира занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дамиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дамира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Damira is 55, married, and raising 3 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is a livestock farmer by trade, first starting 30 years ago with 1,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has 2 dairy cows and a horse on her farm, and her monthly income is nearly 16,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Damira is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy some bull calves.  She plans on using any future earnings due to the loan to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to save money for a car.

loans.use: buy some bull calves for her farm

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Pablita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Pablita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Pablita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fence his farm.

loans.name: Alcides Johany

texts.es:
Alcides es un hombre de 26 años de edad, emprendedor y pujante. Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa pero, en sus tiempos libres, alterna con su negocio independiente, pues vende ropa y mercancía a sus familiares, compañeros, amigos y vecinos del sector, la idea surgió en un momento en que se encontraba realizando compras con un primo, en el local donde se hallaba, vio que el negocio era rentable, pues había mucho flujo de personas dedicándose a esta labor de compra y venta de mercancía. Por ello, decidió asociarse con una amiga y en el año 2012 comenzó a trabajar su negocio independiente, logrando complementar los recursos económicos para aportar a la economía del hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, entre otros) y, cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, así tendrá más variedad de inventario y podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes, abriendo camino hacia un aumento de las ventas. 
Alcides manifiesta que su interés es hacer crecer su negocio, fortalecerlo y mejorar la rentabilidad, para tener una estabilidad económica favorable y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Alcides is 26 years old, enterprising, and thriving. He currently works for a company but, in his free time, he has independent employment where he sells clothing and other merchandise to people he knows, co-workers, friends, and neighbors in his area. The idea came to him when he was shopping with a cousin and they found a storefront that would be profitable because there were a lot of people buying and selling merchandise in the vicinity. And so, he decided to go into business with a friend and in 2012 he began to work in this new business and was able to complement his income and to contribute to household expenses. He is currently asking for a loan in order to purchase wholesale supplies (blouses, jeans, T-shirts and other items) and to settle some debt that he has, as well as have a wider selection of inventory and to be able to satisfy customer demand and increase his sales. Alcides has shown interest in growing his business, making it stronger and more profitable in order to have more favorable economic stability and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale supplies (blouses, jeans, T-shirt and others)

loans.name: Rogellin

texts.en:
Rogellin is 41-years-old and married with one children.

Rogellin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, etc. to sell.

Rogellin has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rogellin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Milagros está en el ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una y poder trabajar.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Yeny quien vende ropa, de variadas clases y marcas, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien gracias a la variedad que siempre ofrece a sus clientes. Es una persona que lucha y se esmera por poder crecer e ir mejorando día a día por medio de su propio trabajo y sacrificio.
La Sra.  Yeny  solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas en general, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas y ofreciendo a sus clientas y clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The group called "Milagros" (Miracles) is in its first loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program.  The members have taken a poverty elimination survey so that each woman can become familiar with her situation, which will help her with her work.

One of the members is Sra. Yeny, who sells clothing of various types and brands.  She says that she is doing very well thanks to the variety that she always offers to her customers.  Yeny is a person who strives and takes great care as she grows and improves each day through her work and her sacrifice.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy general supplies such as jeans, shirts, pants, and other items to continue with her sales and offer her clients that which they need.

loans.use: Comprar prendas, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones y demás

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, aged 33, is married with two unmarried children. She owns and operates a farming business while her husband works as a construction laborer. Farming rice is her focused business since she has learned to do this from her parents. She has been a farmer for more than 15 years and earns approximately KHR 20,000 per day.

In order to help Sophea further develop her farming business, Sophea is asking for a loan to add to her own capital so as to buy a piece of land for farming rice. She hopes this will allow her to have better crop yields and improve the source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming rice.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Rana is a 28-year-old married woman from a village near Qalqilia city. She is a mother for six daughters. Rana's husband is a construction worker. He has a low and not stable income because the demand decreases in the winter. This is the only source of income to the family. Rana's husband would like to improve his job by buying all the needed tools. 

Rana took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy new construction tools for his job. This will improve their job and also their income.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy new construction tools for his job

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Абдурасул 25-летний студент. Он учится во втором курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета в факультете Информатики. Сегодня в эпоху технологии эта специальность очень востребована. Абдурасул учится усердно и в будущем хочет стать хорошим специалистом в этой области. Одновременно он еще и работает, ведь он должен кормить семью. У него жена и двое детей. Жена Абдурасула не работает, ведь дети маленькие, им по 2 и 3 года. Абдурасул со своей семьей живет в районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. 
В данный момент Абдурасул обратился за кредитом. Он хочет оплатить за учебу в университете за 2, 3 и 4-й курс. Он очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Abdurasul is a 25-year-old student. He is in his second year of studying Computer Science at Khujand State University. In today's technological age, this major is very popular. Abdurasul studies diligently and in the future wants to become a talented specialist in this profession. At the same time, he works because he has to feed his family. He has a wife and two children. Abdurasul's wife does not work because the children are still small, two and three years old. Abdurasul and his family live in the B.Gafurov district of Khujand. Abdurasul has applied for a loan. He wants to pay for his second, third, and fourth years of university studies. He hopes that you will support him.

loans.use: pay for his studies at the university for the next three years

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, des condiments  et de l’habillement.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente MARIAM SEYDOU, la seule assise est une vendeuse de pagnes. Elle compte acheter 10 pagnes à Dioïla  qui seront revendus  au village et environs à une clientèle composé essentiellement de femmes en détail et au comptant. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera réinvesti dans l’activité. 
Elle ambitionne  diversifier son activité d’achat et de vente de  pagnes, en y ajoutant des ustensiles.
texts.en: The Benkadi group is made up of married women, who on average are 42 years old, have three children and all live in large traditional families in the village of Fala Sidibela, in the commune of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla, region de Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of parentage, neighborhood, and friendship. They sell grains, sauces and clothing. The women of the Benkadi group are on their twenty-fourth group loan. The client Mariam Seydou, the only one sitting, is a saleswoman of traditional West African cloth (pagne). She expects to buy 10 of these cloths in Dioïla, which will be resold at retail in the village and in surrounding areas to a clientele made up entirely of women for cash. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA per month. This profit will be reinvested in the business. She hopes to diversify her business of buying and selling cloths, adding in the purchase and sale of utensils.

loans.use: to purchase traditional West African cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Sayyohat

texts.ru:
Сайёхат живет в маленьком городке Конибодом. Ей 29 лет. С ней живут ее два сына. Сайёхат работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает английский язык. Сайёхат любит детей и ответственно относится к их образованию.
  В течение 3 лет Саёхат дополнительно дома выращивает крупно рогатых скотов. Правильно ухаживать за скотами ее научила мама. Сайёхат научилась многому у своей матери и в процессе работы узнала много о деятельности животноводства. 
   На данный момент у нее дама есть 2 крупно рогатых скота, и она решила на сумму от кредита увеличить поголовья скотов. Сайёхат очень ответственно относиться к своим обязательствам и уверенна что с деятельностью скотоводства она справится на все 100%.
texts.en:
Sayyohat lives in the small town of Konibodom. She is 29 years old. Her two sons live with her. Sayyohat works as a high school teacher. She teaches English. Sayyohat loves children and is very responsible when it comes to their education. 

For the last three years, Sayyohat has been raising cattle. Her mother taught her how to properly care for cattle. Sayyohat learned a lot from her mother, and while working with cattle, learned a lot about animal husbandry. 

Currently, she has two cows, and she decided to take out a loan to increase her livestock. Sayyohat has a very responsible attitude toward her obligations, and she is confident that she'll be entirely successful in her cattle business.

loans.use: increase her livestock.

loans.name: Sabiniana

texts.en:
Sabiniana is a 60-year-old, married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sabiniana has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

Sabiniana has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob has a tailoring shop that he runs in Kangundo town. He is 32 years old, married and, together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children. 

Jacob plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of sewing materials to make clothes and school uniforms to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is Jacob's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to expand his business and to open a textile shop.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sewing materials.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 53 years old and has six children. Teresa is married and has two children who are in school.

Teresa is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm supplies.

Teresa has been farming vegetables for 25 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Martha Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 40  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, las dos mayores estudia en colegio y las menores en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Martha desde hace 5 años y con ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del banco empezó su negocio, ella adecuo un local en su casa para surtir una pequeña  tienda de víveres que el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos la ha ido mejorando, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ella le ha puesto muchas ganas y amor a su tienda y ahora está recogiendo los frutos con los cuales saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos tiene su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Mar (Virgen of the Sea) Credit Group meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. It is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round by tourists from Ecuador and other countries.  Here, most of the people are engaged in fishing and jobs related to the sea. This is where Martha lives.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children from this relationship, ages 15, 13, 11 and 9. The two older ones are in secondary school and the younger ones are in elementary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Five years ago, with the help of her first loan, Martha began her business.  She set up a small store in her house and stocked with food items. Over time and with the help of loans it has gradually improved.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., sometimes later, and gets help from her children and her husband.  She has put a lot of love and dedication into her store and is now reaping the rewards with which she is supporting her family.  She will use this loan to increase the stock of merchandise in her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other products. She has been with the Communal Bank for five years and she likes it because it is thanks to the loans that she has her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other products.

loans.name: Elisa Jessica

texts.en:
Elisa Jessica works hard to support her family. Elisa Jessica is married and has an internet shop in the Philippines. We can see in the photo that she is with her regular customers in her internet shop.

Elisa Jessica requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of computer for her business.

Elisa Jessica has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Elisa Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 55 years old and married with seven children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Theresa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Theresa has been raising pigs for 15 years, and also earns additional income from selling nipa roofing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.en:
Perseveranda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Perseveranda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.  She has been in this business for three years now.

Perseveranda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosalie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients, like vegetables, meat, and fish.

Rosalie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, and fish.

loans.name: Teodesia

texts.en:
Teodesia is 52 years old and married, with three children. With two children currently in school, Teodesia works very hard to provide for them.

Teodesia runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Teodesia has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, and laundry soap. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Rosalie has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38-years-old and single.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en: Zadock is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be experienced. He operates a retail business where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to add stock of fish. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of fish

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and married with two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Mary Jane has been raising pigs for seven years, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jessenia Patricia

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene  35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, la mayor estudian en colegio y los menores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y también  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Jessenia tiene una pequeña heladería en su casa, la mantiene abierta todos los días pero son los fines de semana cuando mas vende ya que llegan muchas personas al lugar en estos días, ella también le da a su esposo parte del crédito ya que él se dedica a la venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas, plomos, arpones,  entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, el negocio de su marido está ahí mismo junto al de ella por lo cual siempre pasan juntos, solo en los días que su marido se va a pescar es ella quien de hace cargo de todo el negocio, lleva ella 3 años con su heladería y su esposo muchos años mas ya que  es así como el saca adelante su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar helados y materiales de pesca. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó este negocio. Sus sueños son comprar una lancha para la pesca.
texts.en:
The small loan group “Virgen Del Mar” meets every 15 days in the beautiful spa of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited by national and international tourists throughout the year. In this area, the majority of the inhabitants work in fishing and maritime activities.

This is where Jessenia lives. She is 35 years old. She’s married and has three children who are 14, 11, and 9 years old. The oldest is studying in high school and the younger ones are in school. Her husband is a merchant and also fishes.

Jessenia has a small ice cream shop in her house. It is open every day, but it is on the weekends that she sells the most because many people come to the town on those days. She will also give her husband part of the loan because he sells fishing supplies such as nets, fish hooks, string, lead weights, and harpoons, among many other things that people need for good fishing out at sea. Her husband’s business is right there with hers, so they are always together. It is only on days when her husband goes to fish that she take care of the business. She has had her ice cream business for 3 years and her husband has had his for many years as this is how he supports his family.

This loan is for buying ice creams and fishing supplies. She has been in the loan group for 4 years and she likes it because it was with a loan that she started her business. Her dream is to buy a small boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy ice creams and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem is a 60-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, 5 daughters and 2 sons. Waseem's husband is running a gift shop in the market. As their expenses have increased, Waseem's husband is working hard to meet the family's needs. 

Waseem has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from KIVA partner BRAC. With this help of this loan, her husband can expand his shop by adding more gifts. This will allow him to deal with his clients more professionally. She is hopeful that the loan will bring a positive change in their life. She is thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To help her husband expand his gift shop.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. Her son also assists her by purchasing her stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Razia is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and healthcare. 
Razia wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her General Store

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola, a sus 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años, a quien ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo productos de repostería que ella misma elabora, aprendió la actividad junto a su padre, quien se ha desempeñado como panadero durante toda su vida y, por hobby y amor a esta actividad, tomó clases en una escuela de repostería para mejorar sus conocimientos y perfeccionar su técnica, pero con su proyección y el ánimo de salir adelante, vio en esta labor una buena fuente de ingresos por lo que comenzó a promocionar sus productos por medio de las redes sociales en internet, trabaja desde su casa, elaborando cupcakes, postres, tortas y otros productos por encargo, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar; sin embargo, desea emprender su negocio en un local comercial que ya tiene arrendado pero, requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar los activos fijos (vitrinas, batidora, utensilios de cocina, horno, refrigerador, entre otros), materia prima (harina, azúcar, margarina, huevos, leche, entre otros) y realizar mejoras locativas, así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera dar a conocerse en el mercado y aumentar sus ventas. 
Paola es una mujer activa y perseverante y se proyecta para un futuro logrando un reconocimiento en el medio, fortaleciendo su negocio y abrirse camino para montar otros puntos de venta, que le garanticen una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a su hijo un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At her 26 years of age, Paola is the single mother of a 4-year old son.  She works very hard to get him ahead.  She makes her living working as an independent businesswoman.  She sells pastries that she makes herself.  Paola learned the trade from her father, who worked as a baker all of Paola's life.  As a hobby and out of a love for baking, Paola took classes at a baking school.  She improved her knowledge of baking and perfected her technique.  Paola saw baking as a good source of income, which was in line with her plans for the future and her desire to get ahead.  She started promoting her products on social media.  Paola works from home making cupcakes, deserts, cakes and other advance-order items.  Through this work, she generates enough income to support her household.  Nevertheless, she wants to set up her business in a commercial space which she has already rented.  Paola needs the help of the loan to purchase her fixed assets (display cabinets, a mixer, kitchen utensils, an oven, a refrigerator and other items), raw materials (flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, milk and other items) and to make some improvements to the space.  Then she will be able to kick off her project.  She hopes to get to know the market and increase her sales. 
Paola is an active and determined woman.  She intends, in the future, to stand out in her field by strengthening her business and opening pathways to other points of sale.  All this would guarantee her favorable financial stability so she could offer her son a better sense of well-being and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets (display cabinets, a mixer, kitchen utensils, an oven, a refrigerator and other items), raw materials (flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, milk and other items) and to make some improvements to her commercial space.

loans.name: Sreyya

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Sreyya is a 27-year-old, married mother of two children who are dependent on her and still small for school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for seven years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about 32,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 17,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sreyya is just with VisionFund this cycle.  She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR.  She is going to use this loan to harvest rice and also use a portion of it to buy more plots of farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to harvest rice and to buy more plots of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn is 31-years-old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She has three dependent children to take care of.  Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living.  Her husband is a paid construction worker. With the current business, she can earn approximately 38,000 KHR per day and save about 19,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the first micro loan for Sokhorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokhorn will use her portion to pay for harvesting rice and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice and labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Tercer Cielo Group

texts.es:
el grupo tercer cielo esta compuesto por tres integrantes, todos estos se dedican a la venta de pescado en el mercado de chinandega, son madres solteras que se esfuerzan por sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia. una de ellas es la señor juana Maria quien trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, su negocio  lo empezo con capital propio, con poca mercaderia, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leña, es una señora que trabaja para el sustento de su hogar.

solita el financiamiento para invertir en su negocio comprando pescado de variedad y obtener mas ganancias para asi poder levantar nuevamente su casa ya que hace ocho meses a la señora  Juana se le quemo su casa y ella poco a poco la ha venido arreglando con la ganancias.
texts.en:
The group Tercer Cielo is composed of three members, who all sell fish in the market of Chinandega. They are single mothers that work hard to improve their businesses and their families’ lives.

One of them is Juana Maria who works Monday to Sunday from 6am to 4pm. Her business was started with her own capital but had few goods. Before she sold firewood. She is a woman that works to provide for her family. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in her business by buying a variety of fish and to gain more income so that she can rebuild her house, which eight months ago burned down. Since then she has bit by bit rebuilt her house with her profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish, snapper, güicho and urel.

loans.name: Barchinoy

texts.ru:
Барчиной вежливая, умная и ответственная женщина. Она с семьёй живет на районе Спитамен. Ей всего 30 лет. Уже 5 лет она занимается выращивание крупнорогатых скотов. Такой деятельности ее научил муж. Многому она научилась от своего мужа и узнала много интересных деталей о деятельности скотоводства. Продвигать такую деятельность ей помогает ее семья, но не муж. Ее муж находится за приделами страны. Он уехал, чтобы найти хорошую работу и улучшить жизненные условия своей семье. 
   Барчиной наравне с мужем работает дома. Для Барчиной такая работа очень важная это источник дохода в ее семью. Она решила развивать деятельность животноводства и увеличить поголовья скота. Она хочет купить несколько скотов, но не обходимой суммы денег у нее нет. Барчиной просит кредит для купли скотов. Для нее важна Ваша поддержка. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Barchinoy is a polite, intelligent and clever woman.  She's all of 30 and lives with her family in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, where she's been raising cattle for the past 5 years.  Her husband taught her the ins & outs of cattle farming; a trade which actually has a lot of interesting facets and nuances to it, despite what you might think at first.  Her family helps her tend to her cattle with the exception of her husband, who left the country as a migrant worker to try and bolster the family's finances.  Barchinoy works equally as hard as her husband to provide for their family, and would like to develop her cattle-farming business further as it's a crucial source of income for them.  She wants to add more cattle to her herds, but lacks the money to do so; as such, she's requesting a loan to buy some cattle, and is counting on your help to get it.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Старшему сыну 9 лет, а дочери 5 лет. Гульмира очень заботливая мама, хорошая хозяйка и добрая сноха. Вместе с семьей Гульмиры проживают ее свекровь, которой 75 лет и бабушка, которой 81 год. Гульмира успевает по-домашнему хозяйству, по воспитанию детей. У Гульмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, а также имеет 2,70 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. Супруг Гульмиры занимается скупкой-продажей шкур крупно-рогатого скота. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulmira is 29 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband. The eldest son is nine years old, and the daughter is five. Gulmira is a very caring mother, a good housewife, and a good daughter-in-law. Gulmira and her family live with her 75-year-old mother-in-law and 81-year old grandmother. Gulmira manages to do the housework and child-rearing. Gulmira has a secondary education. The family's main source of income is animal husbandry. Gulmira started this nine years ago when she bought 20,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Gulmira's hard work, her farm now has two dairy cows, one horse, one calf, and a 2.70 hectare land share where she grows wheat and corn every year. Gulmira's husband buys and sells cow hides. Their gross monthly income is 8,000 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Gulmira approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cows for breeding. Gulmira plans to invest profits she makes from the loan into expanding her livestock, and plans to save enough money educate her  children.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Yet is 34 years old. She is married with four children, who are still in school. To make a living and support her family, Yet and her husband catch fish. She also sells fish and snails. Having been in this business for 11 years, she is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the second micro loan for Yet with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Yet, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy a boat for her fishing business and also use a portion of it to buy snails to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so she can make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is from Loon, Bohol.  She is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.  She had been operating a Sari-sari store for three years now.  She sell basic household commodities like shampoo, coffee, cooking oil, candies and chips. 

Hilda is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of merchandise to sell like canned goods, soda, candies, chips, seasoning and toiletries.  With a loan she will be able to expand her business and make stock available all the time.  In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business and make her store bigger.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soda, candies, chips, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is single with no children and is a university student.  She resides with her family and they have access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes her own school fees  

She generates income from a boutique and works in a shop selling on retail basis and works six days out of every week

She has applied for a loan through MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of weaves, braids and hair spray.  Her major business challenges includes seasonality and irregular working electricity. She dreams of owning a fully stocked beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of weaves,braids and hair sprays.

loans.name: Leam

texts.en:
Leam is 25 years old and single. She lives with her parents and other siblings in a rural village of Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. 

Leam graduated from high school in 2012 and enrolled to University of South-East Asia in their province. She is now a second-year student majoring in accounting. She loves this major because she thinks that it’s suitable for her personality. To help her parents cover her education costs, Leam is currently employed part-time at a golf club and earns a monthly income of USD45.00. 

Due to the family’s financial constraints, Leam is experiencing difficulties to cover her education fees, so she decided to take out a loan in the amount of 1,200 US dollars, which will enable her to cover the overall fees for the remaining two-years of classes.

Leam is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via a program like Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher education, and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover her education fees.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, a sus 55 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Durante su vida productiva trabajó como empleada en diferentes restaurantes, donde adquirió experiencia y conocimiento en el manejo de este tipo de negocio, gracias a ello, hace un mes tomó la decisión de independizarse y montar su propio local de comidas rápidas, donde cuenta con la ventaja de no poseer competidores directos en el sector, por lo que hasta ahora le ha dado buenos resultados. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en realizar adecuaciones locativas (arreglar la acera), comprar mesas, sillas y terminar de pagar los activos fijos que ya adquirió y comprar surtido al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, queso, aceite, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de prestar un servicio con mayor calidad tanto en la comida, en la comodidad del espacio y en la atención, lo que para ella significa avanzar y mejorar sus ventas. 
Alicia sueña con abrir un restaurante en un local comercial, que sea amplio y reconocido en el sector, en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y le permita garantizar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para disfrutar en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old. She has two children and is in a common law marriage with her significant other. During her working life she worked as an employee in several restaurants. That's where she acquired experience and knowledge on how to handle this type of business. Thanks to that, a month ago she decided to become self-employed and set up her own fast food stall. She has the advantage of not facing direct competition in this segment, which is why she has obtained good results so far. She requests the loan in order to use it to do remodeling work (repair the sidewalk), purchase tables and chairs, finish paying for the fixed assets that she already acquired, and purchase wholesale supplies (bread, cold cuts, spices, cheese, cooking oil, etc.). That way she'll be able to provide a higher quality service in terms of the food, the comfort in her premises and the courtesy. This means that she'll move forward and improve her sales.
Alicia dreams of opening a restaurant in a commercial area that is large and well-known in the segment. This restaurant could create employment opportunities and allow her to ensure that her children's living conditions and well-being will improve, so they can enjoy this as a family.

loans.use: to do remodeling work (repair the sidewalk), to purchase tables and chairs, to finish paying for the fixed assets that she already acquired, and to purchase wholesale supplies (bread, cold cuts, spices, cheese, cooking oil, etc.).

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 2 children. She is a farmer in Kangundo and has been in this business for the last five years. 

She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and poultry feeds such as chick mash. She will also buy chicks for rearing. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and open a salon business.

This is Josephine's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to own her own salon business, educate her children and give them a good life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and poultry feed.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a 63-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 42 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to do more agribusiness within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 67-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 11 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for 40 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes that affect tea growth. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi
Alajuela

Daysi tiene 48,  Mujer nicaragüense, en su país  obtiene un título de contabilidad, carrera que maneja  a la par de su habilidad para cocinar. Ante la mala situación económica en su país viene a Costa Rica hace más de 15 años, donde trabaja en diferentes lugares, incluyendo sodas y restaurantes. Hace 5 años abre su local, que instala en San Rafael de Alajuela; con su punto consolidado y ante el incremento en el costo del alquiler, se traslada a trabajar a su casa, donde requiere hacer mejoras en el corredor de su casa y comprar equipo para seguir ofreciendo un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
Con trabajo y esfuerzo propio adquiere parte del  equipo y mobiliario propio, además inicia los pagos por la compra de un lote, y ha logrado levantar una humilde casa; donde desea remodelar  y trasladar su soda. Con su trabajo ha logrado forjar su capital y crecer su negocio.
Cuenta con el negocio de comidas y además en ventas por catálogo. Negocio estable y conocido en la zona, en este momento funciona fines de semana y mantiene pedidos ocasionales entre semana. El  cambio de ubicación  le va a permitir reducir costos e instalarse en lo propio. Su negocio cuenta con la capacidad de poder cubrir la cuota del préstamo en el plazo establecido.
 Experiencia en la actividad, punto consolidado en la zona, requiere de mejoras para el traslado a su propiedad.
texts.en:
Daysi is a 48-year-old Nicaraguan woman who is received an accounting degree in her own country. She works in this field alongside cooking. She came to Costa Rica 15 years ago in the face of the poor economic situation in her country. She has worked in a variety of places including food stalls and restaurants. Five years ago she opened her own shop, located in San Rafael de Alajuela. With her business established and ahead of an increase in the cost of rent, she has moved her work to her home. Here she must make improvements to the entryway of her home and buy equipment to continue offering high quality service to her customers. 

With hard work and her own efforts, she acquired some of the equipment and furniture. She is also starting payment for the purchase of a plot of land and has been able to build a humble home that she would like to remodel and locate her stall. With her hard work she has acquired capital and grown her business. 

In addition to the business selling food she also makes catalog sales. This business is stable and well known in the area. She currently works on  the weekends and takes occasional orders during the week. The change of location will allow her to reduce her expenses and have her store located on her own property. Her business holds the capacity to cover the loan payments in the term established due to her experience, and established local stall. She needs to make home improvements to move the business to her property.

loans.use: to buy equipment and remodel the business space.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes that affect tea growth. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea.

loans.name: Dexi Lilibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Dexi, tiene  31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 5 años de edad, el mayor estudian en colegio y los menores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Dexi para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y  productos por catálogos de Avon, y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana, ella aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que en esos días ellos tiene bastante dinero y es cuando más le compran, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Lleva más de 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde que se inicio el grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas. Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group Virgen del Mar meets every 15 days in the beautiful coastal town of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited at all times of the year by both national and foreign tourists. Here the majority of the inhabitants are dedicated to fishing and tasks of the sea. 

This is where Dexi lives; she is 31 years old, married, and from this union has three children of 13, 9 and 5 years of age. The oldest studies in secondary school and the younger are in primary school. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Doña Dexi, in order to earn for her account, is dedicated to the sale of all types of clothing and products from Avon and Yanbal catalogues (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). Her form of sale is going door to door and she works three to four days a week. She takes advantage of when the fishermen arrive from high seas because during these days people have plenty of money and make more purchases. She offers goods on credit and collects payments each week.  She has been working for more than 6 years in this business and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics and lotions. She has been in the loan group since it began and she likes it because her partners are very accomplished. Her dream is to continue forward in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, imitation jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Sour is 62 years old and is a married woman from Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. Sour has six children, five of whom are employed in various positions; only her youngest child is still going to school and depends on her income. She has been in the farming business for more than 30 years. This is the main source of her income.

Sour is asking for a loan, which she will use to improve the sanitation of her family. With this loan, she will be able to build materials for supporting the construction of a latrine and pay for labor costs incurred in performing the construction. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sour is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build materials for the construction of a latrine and pay for labor costs incurred in performing the construction.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is married with five children. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (brother's child). She has a business selling cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants. She has been in this business for 4 months. She has applied for a loan of 30,0000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants. She generates additional income from working as a cashier at a nearby clinic. She works six days out of every week and sells to all types of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to educate her children up to university and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is 43, married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in a rural community of Kampong Cham province and manages a small grocery store in front of her home. She sells various kinds of products to her neighbor and local people and normally she is able to make a net profit of USD2.50 per day. Sreymom always tries to stock more products in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. 

Sreymom would like to improve her family’s living standards, so she is asking for a loan to build a sanitary latrine at home and buy some accessories for it. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sreymom is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a sanitary latrine at home and buy some accessories for it.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat was born in 1981. Latofat is married and has 5 children. Her children are non-adults. Latofat has been busy sewing national dresses more than 5 years. She sews dresses in her house. Latofat tries to provide services to a high quality.

Latofat is ill. She must buy medicine for treatment. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy medicine for treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Tofasi

texts.en: Tofasi is single with no children. She takes care of additional family members (young sister and brother). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothes like skirts and blouses. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements, and defaulters. She is aspiring to have a permanent business place and also to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because she wanted to acquire more capital for her business. She resides in her own house and has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her siblings and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 50 years old, married and blessed with five children. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and medicine for her pigs. Usually her profits are spent on her children's allowances and the rest is for daily expenditures. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her business so that she can help her husband in providing education for their children.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine for pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 70 years old and married, with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like biscuits, coffee, and milk.

Vilma has been in this business for 40 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like biscuits, coffee, and milk.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 31 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Vanessa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell like milk, bath soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, and noodles. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Vanessa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like milk, bath soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Emelita is requesting a 8000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Emelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima is from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is 46 years old, married and has four children ages three to eighteen. Her husband is a carpenter and does not have a stable income. She makes baskets and raises hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed to fatten her hogs. A loan will sustain her business and will make her pigs healthy. In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a man of thirty-seven years. He is married to Wilkistar and a father of three children. He runs a food stall in Nairobi city centre. He has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Robert's fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy food like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc. for his business. In the future, he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy food stuff like rice, cooking flour, etc. for the food stall.

loans.name: Liberita

texts.en:
Liberata is from Corella, Bohol. She is married with four children and has been earning a living raising hogs for more than 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed to help them grow. A loan will definitely boost her business once the feed is available for her pigs. In this way, she will not have to worry about buying feed on a per-kilo basis in a sari-sari store and she will be able to focus on looking after her hogs and taking care of the piglets.
