In the future, she hopes to make a bigger piggery and expand her business. She also dreams of having a savings for when she reaches old age.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en: Crescencia is from Antequera, Bohol. She is a 56-year-old married woman. For 15 years now, she has been operating a food vending business where she sells home-cooked meals. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like meat, seasoning, cooking oil, and vegetables. With a loan, she can continue doing business while also paying for daily household expenses like food. She hopes to save to expand her business and have savings.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasoning, cooking oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She also sells cereals to earn extra income and owns dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy stock of tea and cereals. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of tea and cereals.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as reliable. 

He operates a retail business where he offers printing and photocopying services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for buying stationery.  He also owns a farm where he grows tea to sell.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to stock supplies of printing paper, cartridges and other materials to enable him serve customers well. His business goal is to be stable within 5 years. He hopes that he will have a better future.  This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to stock supplies of printing paper, cartridges and other materials

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias


María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo; durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 2 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche, estas actividades las realiza tanto María como su esposo, ambos ayudan.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para producir mas leche para la venta y así incrementar sus ingresos.

María planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de leche, poder comprar en un futuro un terreno para pastar sus animales ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old, studied until the ninth grade, and is a married woman; her husband works in agriculture. She wakes up at 4:30 a.m. with her husband to carry out the daily activities.

Maria works in agriculture, a trade which her husband taught her; during the morning they work in the land plots. She walks 2 km to get there. During the afternoon they milk the cows to sell the milk. These activities are done both by Maria and her husband.

They are requesting the loan to buy two dairy cows, in order to produce more milk to sell and thus increase their income. 

In the future, Maria plans to buy land that is currently rented for her animals to graze with the income that she obtains from selling the milk.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is a 46-year-old man from the village of Guturi. He lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law, who is a student. His wife is a teacher and generates 420 GEL per month. Mamuka is extensively engaged in the agribusiness, which is the most important source of their family's income. For more than 10 years, Mamuka has been involved in cattle breeding and in cultivation of maize and nuts. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Mamuka wants to somehow expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of 3,000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase stock of merchandise for his newly-opened grocery store. He has already purchased some of them and now he has requested a loan for working capital. Mamuka and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and would greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To have money for working capital

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan feels very grateful. She and the Anyar Sari 1 group succeeded in making their payments. As they expected, all the pigs grew healthy and fat, and were sold out. They earned a satisfactory profit. The profits were used to fulfill their daily needs, school fees, and saving.
 
In this new loan, Ni Wayan was chosen as the head again because she’s a responsible woman. One of the members decided to stop borrowing because she’s focused on helping her husband at the garden to plant the crops. She will continue her loan in the next loan period. There's a new member joining the group.

Ni Wayan used her loan to purchase superior feed only. She bought piglets using her own money taken from the profit from the last loan period. She hopes she can increase her saving and later use it as business capital.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una gran esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus labores de pesca, el en compañía de sus hijos se adentran a alta mar en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, se van por tres a cuatro días junto con otras embarcaciones de amigos de la zona, una vez que obtienen una buena cantidad de peces regresan y en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes los cuales los venden al menudeo.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda,  Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The "Virgen del Mar" loan group meets every fortnight in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo, in the city of Manta. This is an area known for its beautiful beaches, frequented by national and international tourists all year round. Here most people make a living in fishing and other work related to the sea.

And it is here that 49-year-old María lives. She is married and, with her husband, has four children, all now independent adults. María's husband is a fisherman.

María is a good wife and is taking out this loan to help her husband with his fishing work. Along with their children, María's husband goes out to the sea in their little boat to fish. They go out for three or four days with other boats manned by local friends. Once they have caught a good number of fish, the boats return to shore and at the beach they deliver their products to businessmen who sell them retail.

This loan will be used to buy nets, ropes, petrol and foodstuffs for the days spent travelling the high seas. María is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are a great help. María's dream is to have a big boat for her husband to go out fishing in.

loans.use: to buy nets, ropes, petrol and food.

loans.name: Mirian Francisca

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 41  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 15 y 11 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en  colegio y escuela. Todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mirian es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar aprovecha para hacer la mayoría de sus ventas. Ella lleva 4 años dedicada a esta profesión con la cual ayuda a su marido con los gastos que generan la educación de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede salir adelante, Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The "Virgen del Mar" loan group meets every fortnight in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo, in the city of Manta. This is an area known for its beautiful beaches, frequented by national and international tourists all year round. Here most people make a living fishing and other work related to the sea.

And it is here that 41-year-old Mirian lives. She is married and has three children, aged 19, 15 and 11 years old respectively. The youngest two children are in primary and high school and all three still live at home. Mirian's husband is a fisherman.

Mirian is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, works selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door, working three days per week. She sells on credit and collects payments every fortnight. When the fisherman arrive back from their trips, Mirian takes advantage to go out and make most of her sales. Mirian has been doing this work for four years and, with it, helps her husband with the costs of bringing up their children.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. Mirian is a founding member of the loan group and she likes it because the loans allow her to prosper. Mirian's dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver  is married with one child and she doesn’t go to school.  She also takes care of her sister's children.   She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

She has a business of selling Irish potato chips.  She works at the market and sells seven days a week.  

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged.   She has applied for a loan of 200000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, charcoal and cooking oil.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She dreams of owning a restaurant and also of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bags of irish potatoes, charcoal and cooking oil

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Roeun is 51 years old and a resident of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she is involved in two business ventures of farming rice and selling kitchen products in her surrounding communities. Her husband gives her great support in managing their business, ensuring a consistent income for the family. Having been in these businesses for years, Roeun is able to earn approximately USD $10.00 per day. 

In order to maintain her business in a sustainable way, Roeun has requested a loan of USD $1,000 to buy stock of kitchen supplies, such as plastic baskets, bowls, porcelain dishes and cutting boards, for wholesaling to market vendors. This investment may return good revenue in the future. She is very thankful for the funds granted by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock of kitchen supplies, such as plastic baskets, bowls, porcelain dishes and cutting boards for wholesaling to market vendors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do some work on the family home; the little kids have been feeling very cold this winter

loans.name: Onik

texts.en:
Onik lives in Shahumyan village with his retired mother who is 80 years old. He has been involved in poultry-keeping. Onik also owns arable land where he cultivates wheat, potatoes and tomatoes. He sells the agricultural products to local re-sellers and earns income which is very important for sustaining a living. 

As the only worker in the family, Onik feels very responsible for providing good living conditions for his mother. He has requested this loan for financial help which he needs for purchasing poultry, special forage for feeding them, and fertilizer for cultivation. This will enable Onik to enlarge his poultry-keeping which is very important to him. As this is Onik's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The loan will be a big support for this young farmer and he hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for poultry, special forage for feeding them, and fertilizer for cultivation

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en: Gocha is a 34-year-old experienced farmer, from the village of Bukistsikhe. He lives with his parents, wife and 2 little children. Gocha's father is a wood artisan and generates 350 GEL monthly. The family is highly involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows and a plot of agricultural land where nuts and grapes are grown. Gocha sells the farm's products locally. He always has fresh and high quality products. For further development, Gocha decided to be involved in another activity parallel to agricultural and he requested a loan. His application was approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start a business. So, with the approved loan, he will buy a truck and work with private orders. Gocha's income will significantly increase with the help of this new activity. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for the aid.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to use to fill private orders.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a 10000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients like meat, pork liver, and hot dogs for her business. She has been in this business for 21 years.

Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, pork liver, and hot dogs for her business

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: La señora Armida tiene 44 años y es casada con  hijos de las edades de 12 y 14 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa de trabajo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Villa Esperanza, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Armida va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, ladrillos y demas materiales, para la construcción de un cuarto en su casa y así tener ella más comodidad y tambien brindar mas comodidad a su familia,  la señora Armida enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas personas  que se dedican a la venta de ropa, péro ella siempre esta variando su mercaderia, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su unica actividad que le permite mamntener asu familia y mediante esta actividad tambien mejorar la construccion y el arreglo se su casita.
texts.en:
Armida is 44 years old, married with two children who are 12 and 14 years old. She works selling clothing from a market stall in the Villa Esperanza zone of El Alto. 

This will be her second loan from this microfinance institution, and Armida plans to use the loan to buy construction materials like cement, brick, and other materials to add a room to her house and make it more comfortable for her family. Armida faces many challenges in her business, including high competition since there are many people in her area who also sell clothes, but she is always varying her merchandise. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is provided with because it allows her to support her family and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, and doors

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stock like soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, and eggs. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, such as snack foods, bread, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to resell.

Yolanda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, such as snack foods, bread, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío de Colaguay, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa tienen una bodega donde ofrece venta de abarrotes y frutas que el mismo cultiva Tomás cultiva, también se dedica al cultivo de café que lo comercializa en Jaén, que es la ciudad de centro de acopio de las zonas cafetaleras del norte del País.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de frutas y café para tener una mejor producción para vender y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is 61 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of Colaguay, in a rural zone in the district of Pomahuaca. Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is part of the province of Jaén, located in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Together with his wife, he has a shop where he sells groceries and fruits that he grows. He also raises coffee, which he sells in Jaén, the city that is the collection center for the coffee-growing regions of northern Peru. 

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 4000 PEN to maintain his fruit and coffee crops in order to have better production to sell, and in this way to have better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost to maintain his fruit and coffee crops

loans.name: Ich

texts.en:
Ich is 52 years old and married with seven children. They live in a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Storng district. He and his wife earn a living through rice farming which they have been involved with for 32 years. The current business earns them about $10 per day, but Ich can save about $4 each day after his daily expenses. 

Ich has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. He completely paid back the past loans which have helped him better support his family. Now, he is applying for an education loan to pay for his daughter’s university tuition fees to study midwifery. He hopes to keep his daughter in university to pursue the degree so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s university tuition fees.

loans.name: María Oliva

texts.es:
María, a sus 57 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un almacén de ropa y calzado que tiene hace varios años y, que inició como una alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran llevar el sustento a su hogar, pues es madre cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Adicionalmente vende productos por catálogo, con lo que complementa los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (blusas, jeans, zapatos, sandalias, perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, entre otros), realizar adecuaciones locativas y comprar una estantería, esto le permitirá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes en la temporada de navidad, en la que sus ventas se incrementan, además podrá exhibir mejor sus productos y dará una mejor imagen al local, lo que le ayudará a atraer nuevos y potenciales clientes. 
María manifiesta que su principal interés con el negocio es llegar a disfrutar su vejez con un ingreso fijo que le proporcione estabilidad y tranquilidad, para compartir con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 57 years old and runs her own business, a clothing and shoe store she has owned for several years. She started it as a way of obtaining profits which have allowed her to support her household, because she has been the family's sole breadwinner ever since she separated from her husband. In addition, she sells merchandise by catalog, which is how she supplements the income she earns for her work. She currently requests the loan in order to use it to purchase an assortment of wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, shoes, sandals, perfumes, body lotion, cosmetics, etc.), do remodeling work and purchase shelves. This will allow her to meet her customers' needs during Christmas season, when her sales increase. Besides, she'll be able to better display her products and improve the appearance of her premises, which will help her to attract new potential customers. María reports that her main goal with this business is to eventually enjoy old age with a steady income. This will provide her with stability and peace of mind so that she can share a better quality of life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, shoes, sandals, perfumes, body lotion, cosmetics, etc.), do remodeling work and purchase shelves.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, con 30 años de edad, es madre de una hija de 3 años y felizmente casada. Hace aproximadamente 5 años, montó su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en un espacio de su casa, allí atiende sola todos los días vendiendo productos de la canasta familiar, adicionalmente y como complemento para sus ingresos, en las noches vende comidas rápidas en la acera de su vivienda, lo que le permite percibir mejores ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. 
Solicita el apoyo de su tercer ciclo crediticio, para comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, carnes frías, huevos, galletería, gaseosas, entre otros) y un enfriador, así podrá tener disponibilidad de inventario para satisfacer las necesidades de su compradores y clientes y podrá almacenar mejor sus productos para garantizar la calidad de los mismos. 
Liliana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ver crecer su negocio, que se posicione en el mercado y perdure en el tiempo para que le garantice una rentabilidad económica que le permita dar a su hija una excelente educación y disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Liliana is 30 years old. She has a 3-year-old daughter and is happily married. About five years ago she started her own business, a grocery store located in a space within her house. There she serves customers on her own by selling products that are household staples on a daily basis. In addition, as a way of supplementing her income, she sells fast food on the sidewalk in front of her home in the evenings. This allows her to obtain higher profits so that she can help her husband bear the financial burden of the household.
She requsts the help of her third loan cycle in order to purchase wholesale merchandise (dairy products, cold cuts, eggs, pastries, soft drinks, etc.) and a cooler. That way she'll be able to stock up so that she can meet her customers' and her clients' needs. She'll be able to better store her products in order to ensure their quality.
Liliana reports that her biggest wish is to see her business grow, establish herself in the business and keep it afloat. This will guarantee financial returns which will allow her to provide her daughter with an excellent education and enjoy better living conditions alongside her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (dairy products, cold cuts, eggs, pastries, soft drinks, etc.) and a cooler.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El Sr. Eleuterio sigue con la misma actividad de agricultor, sembrando variedad de productos, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de semillas para la siembra de arroz, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y también lo utilizara en el preparado de la tierra para la siembra y así seguir mejorando su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos en la foto se encuentra con su moto ya que es esta que le transporta desde su parsela a los distintos lugares para movilizarse ya que son distancias largas.
texts.en:
Eleuterio continues his work as a farmer planting a variety of products. He comments that his previous loan went well for him because he used it to buy seeds to plant rice. He is requesting a loan this time to buy corn seeds and will also use the loan to prep his land for planting so that he can continue improving production and thus, his earnings. 

He is shown with a motorcycle in his picture because this is the transportation he uses to travel long distances.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn and prep the land for planting.

loans.name: Soro

texts.en:
Soro sews wonderful national Tajik women's dresses. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all her deals. He is a migrant from the Russian Federation.

Soro sews dresses in her house and she has her own regular customers. Soro always works for the well-being of her family. She is going to repair her house, as her house is in bad condition but she does not have enough money to fix it. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy building materials for repairing her house. She thanks all creditors in advance for their support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 32-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 2 and 4. He describes himself as patient, God-fearing and determined.

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of sufficient funds to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes.

William will use the 60,000 KES loan to add to his stock of fabric and threads, and to buy one sewing machine. His business goal is to build his own home within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children up to the university level. He will use the anticipated profits to buy farm inputs to enable him to farm and also pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to add to his stock of fabric and threads, and to buy one sewing machine

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Sarakap village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two school-age children. Karine and her husband have been involved in agriculture for many years. They keep livestock, including chickens, pigs, piglets, cows and calves, in addition to cultivating wheat. Karine uses the milk for cheese production and her husband sells it along with the gathered harvest in nearby open markets. 

Now, in order to improve their agribusiness, Karine asks for this loan. The loan will help her to purchase fertilizer, seeds and forage for the livestock. As this is Karine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

The loan is very important for Karine and her husband to improve their farm and gather more income for their children.

loans.use: to pay for ferilizer, seeds, and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 66 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, y comercio de agregados a menudeo desde hace 15 años por lo que es muy conocido en el medio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y asi seguir brindando este servicio de una manera segura, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 66 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Cayalti district.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Eduardo has worked in public transport with his own mototaxi, and in retail gravel sales for the past 15 years.  He is well known in this business and has requested a loan of 2,000 new soles to maintain his vehicle to continue providing safe service in order to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Ruth Vanessa

texts.es:
Ruth Vanessa tiene 20 años de edad, vie junto a su hijo y esposa, Oyotun su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad hospitalaria donde ofrecen platillos de todos los gustos, ubicados a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de recargas de saldo a teléfonos móviles, en la parte posterior a su domicilio se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, gallinas y patos, es un padre emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la comprar saldo para recargas de telefonía celular y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Vanessa is 20 years old. She lives together with her son and her spouse in Oyotun, where the population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production. Located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru, it is a hospitable place where they offer foods for all tastes.

She earns her living selling pre-paid mobile phone minutes. In the back of her house, she raises and sells young animals, like turkeys, chickens and ducks. She is a hardworking mother. 

Ruth Vanessa has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to purchase minutes to recharge cellular phone accounts so she can generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase minutes to recharge mobile phone accounts.

loans.name: Jessa Joy

texts.en:
Jessa Joy is 41 years old and married with two children.

Jessa Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

She has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Jessa Joy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 39 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Aida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. for her food vending business.

Aida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura vive en la ciudad de Chincha, trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un pequeño restaurante de su ciudad, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que es madre de 4 niños.

Laura esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar utensilios como boul, platos, cucharas, entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y sobre todo poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Laura lives in the city of Chincha and works as a ktichen assistant in a small restaurant in the city.  With this job, she earns enough to get ahead and to cover household costs.  Laura is a mother to four children.

Laura is grateful to Kiva investors as, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy utensils such as bowls, plates, spoon and more and, with these items, she will be able to offer her customers better service and, above all, can increase her income and continue fight to make her dream of having her own house a reality.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La señora Elsa tiene 24 años y es casada con 1 hijos que es un varón de un año,  la cliente se dedica a la venta de ropa y prendas de vestir que se encuentran en feria de la zona Pacajes en la ciudad del Alto, este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado con la institución, la señora Elsa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería de temporada por las fiestas de fin de año para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para realizar la compra,  la señora Elsa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que tiene mucha competencia en su mercado que muchas personas se dedican al mismo rubro, va a utilizar los beneficios la señora Elsa comprando mercadería por  temporadas y se abastecerá de mercadería, su deseo para su negocio es que quiere invertir en su negocio de ropa para generar mayores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa is 24 years old. She is married with one child, who is a one-year-old boy. She works selling clothing and garments in the Pacajes area market in the city of El Alto. This is the first loan that she has taken out with the organization.

Elsa is going to use this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise for the end-of-the-year festivities in order to stock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of cash to make her purchase. Elsa confronts obstacles in her business; she has a lot of competition in her market because many people work in the same field.

Elsa is going to use the profits to buy seasonal merchandise and to stock up on merchandise. Her desire for her business is that she wants to invest in her own clothing business to generate more income, in order to give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise for the end-of-the-year festivities.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Leonel esta separado. De edad 42 años. Curso 5 años de educación secundaria. Tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos van a la escuela. Se dedica a la sastrería. Inició este negocio trabajando con un amigo y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales como conos, agujas, telas, etc. En el futuro desea tener su propio capital de trabajo y poeder exportar su sprendas de vestir al extranjero.

Las demá integrantes del grupo se dedican la venta de ropa y tiendas de consumo diario.

En la fotografía aparecen 9 personas, pero, solo a 7 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Edgar Leonel, 42, is separated from his partner with whom he has three children, two of whom are in school. He completed 5 years of secondary education. He works as a tailor. He started the business with a friend and now has 10 years of experience.

He organized a group and asked for a loan that he will use to buy materials like cones, needles, fabric, etc. In the future he wants to have his own business capital and to be able to export his garments to other countries.

The other group members sell clothing and run a general store. In the picture, 9 members of the group are shown, but only 7 of them are taking out a loan this round.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Germania Adelita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Germania, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y tres de  13, 10 y 5 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Germania es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para tener sus propios ingresos por el bien de sus familia, es por eso que hace seis años decidió arrendar un local en una estación de servicios y montar un pequeño mini market el cual le está dando muy buenas satisfacciones, ella utilizo lo que recibió en uno de los créditos para empezar y luego y gracias a los créditos lo ha ido surtiendo aun mas hasta tener su negocio como ella quería, allí trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su familia ya que es por ellos que ella lucha incansablemente día a día para darles una buena educación para que se formen un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su local, va a comprar azúcar, arroz, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 7 años y le gusta porque con uno de los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que los arriendos se le llevan gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The La Inmaculada Communal Bank meets in the city of Tosagua every 15 days.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of its inhabitants work in farming and livestock as it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

This is where Germania lives.  She is 37 years old and has a common-law marriage and five children, two of whom are adults and three who are 13, 10, and 5 years old who are in school.  Her partner is a driver. 

Germania is a woman who likes to work so she can have her own income for the good of her family.  For this reason, six years ago she decided to rent a space at a gas station and set up a small minimart that has been doing very satisfactorily.  She used what she received from one of her loans to start and then thanks to more loans she has been stocking it even more until she has her business the way she wants it.  She works there every day with the help of her family, as it is for their sake that she works tirelessly day after day to provide them with a good education so they can have a better future. 

She will use this loan to stock her store more; she will buy sugar, rice, detergents, sausage, and other necessities.  She has been with her communal bank for seven years and she likes it because she started her business with one of their loans.  Her dream is to have her own space, as the rent takes a large part of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, detergents, sausage, and other necessities.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en: Cerelina is 53 years old, married and the mother of seven children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her animals. She has been in her current line of work for 25 years and has taken out one prior loan from NWTF. Cerelina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en: Lavella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling sea shells in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 from NWTF to buy more of these items to sell. Lavella successfully paid back her previous loan and is seeking a new loan to expand her business. NWTF is re-listing her business profile to help support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 55 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, sugar, etc. Lina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household items to sell

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, se decidió a tomar otro crédito para invertir en la siembra de granos básicos, comprara abono, pagara mano de obra y una maquina desgranadora, que le permitan desgranar la cosecha obtenida. 
Con la inversión del crédito anterior Miguel, pudo sembrar sin ningún problema, su cosecha fue más abundante, sus ventas han aumentado, los ingresos son mayores, cancelo sus cuotas puntualmente. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Miguel decided to take out another loan to invest in the sowing of basic grains, purchase fertilizer, pay laborers, and purchase a threshing machine. The threshing machine will permit him to remove the grains from the harvest.

With his previous loan, Miguel was able to sow his fields without any problems. His harvest was more abundant, his sales increased, his income increased, and he made his payments on time.

His family is healthy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pay laborers, and purchase a threshing machine.

loans.name: Nancy Margarita

texts.es:
Nancy  tiene 30 años de estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.


Nancy  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en la Parroquia Ricaurte donde el Dr. Agro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos y  fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  poder ayudar a mis hijos para que estudien.


Le gusta trabajar y dedicarse a la familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and her children in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Ríos. The San Nicolás solidarity group is located in the recinto [a small rural settlement] of San Nicolás, in the canton of Ventanas. This solidarity group focuses on short-term agricultural work, such as growing corn and rice.

Nancy has worked in agriculture growing corn and rice for three years. She buys her products in the parish of Ricaurte in Dr. Agro [a chain of Ecuadorean agricultural supply stores]. She also sells her products in the market of Ricaurte.

She requested this loan to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. The loan helped her to increase her income to meet her family’s needs and to invest. Her dream is to be able to help her children so that they can go to school. She likes to work and to devote herself to her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to rent land.

loans.name: María Lucero

texts.es:
María, a sus 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años, a quien ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Desde hace varios años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo ropa a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos y en algunas ocasiones viaja a otros municipios a vender mercancía al por mayor en algunos almacenes, trabaja sola todos los días y aprendió esta actividad de manera empírica, pero siempre ha estado involucrada en este campo de acción, pues en su familia se han dedicado a la confección de prendas  de vestir. 
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor  (blusas, jeans, camisas, entre otros), así complementará su inventario con más variedad de artículos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando notablemente las ventas en esta temporada decembrina en las que sus pedidos son mayores, generando un mejor nivel de utilidades.
María, con su perseverancia y empuje, sueña hacer crecer su negocio, que sea más rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y dar a su hijo una educación con calidad, para que tenga un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, is a single mother with a 10-year-old son, who she moves forward with a lot of effort. For several years, she has worked as an independent vendor selling clothing to her family, friends, and neighbors. Sometimes, she also travels to other towns to sell wholesale merchandise to stores. She works on her own every day. She learned this work in an empiricist manner but she is always involved in the action. People in her family make a living by making clothing.

She decided to request this loan so she could buy wholesale merchandise including blouses, jeans, shirts, and other items. This will complement her inventory with a variety of choices to satisfy the needs and preferences of her customers. This will notably improve her December sales, which is when her sales are the largest, and she will make her business more valuable.

With perseverance and initiative, Maria dreams of growing her business so that it is more profitable and long-lasting with time. This will provide her with good economic stability to enjoy a better quality of life and allow her to give her son a good education so he will have a brighter, more prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as blouses, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Fátima Gisela

texts.es:
Fátima de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 año bachillerato, es madre soltera de un hijo de 13 años que estudia 7 grado.

Ella se dedica a vender lácteos, lo aprendió por medio de su mamá. El negocio lo tiene en su casa de 6 :00 de la mañana  a 6:00 de la tarde.

La cliente utilizara el préstamo,  para comprar queso y crema. Mejorará su vida, ya que tendrá mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.

Su deseo es, que su negocio crezca y que su familia tenga mejores ingresos para su familia, las ganancias las utilizara para la alimentación de su hijo y para ampliar su negocio
texts.en:
Fátima is 38 years old and studied until her third year of high school. She is the single mother of a 13-year-old son studying in the 7th grade.

She has sold milk for 20 years, an activity she learned through her mother. She runs this business from her home during the hours of 6:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening.

Fátima will use this loan to buy cheese and cream. It will improve her life because she will have a better income for herself and her family.

Her desire is to grow her business and to have a better income for her family. Her earnings will be used to feed her child and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: Ainaz

texts.en:
Ainaz is a freshman in the Sociology Program. This is her story:

My name is Ainaz, and I am 17 years old. In high school I had the chance to study at a private school because the principal helped support me financially. That gave me the chance to learn English, but I did not like the school in general because it had too few subjects and too few teachers. Many of my classmates graduated and are still not sure of where they will be able to work in the future. I am happy to be studying at AUCA because I know that when I graduate I will be able to get a job. I really want to help improve the education system in Kyrgyzstan, and I think that studying sociology will help me to understand the people and how they think, and that will help me to be able to change the system. At AUCA I will have future prospects. There are a lot of opportunities to improve my talents, to study abroad, and to be a part of the AUCA community. For example, I will take a Spanish class, since I have always wanted to learn this language.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Asociación Adicho Group

texts.es:
El señor Santiago de estado civil casado. De edad 49 años. Cursó 3 años de educacion primaria. Tiene 7 hijos y los 7 están estudiando. Se dedica a la agricultura. Inició este negocio aprendiendo con su padre y a la fecha lleva 29 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para su cosecha de papas y arbeja china. Desea en el futuro contar con más terreno para poder sembrar por mayor y poder exportar sus productos.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura.

En la fotografía aparecen 17 integrantes pero solo a 16 de ellos se le concedió el crédito.
texts.en:
Santiago is 49 years old and married. He completed 3 years of primary school and has 7 children who are all attending school. He works in agriculture and he began this business, learning from his father. To date he has 29 years of experience.
	
He is organizing a group, and is seeking a loan that he will use to purchase fertilizer for his crop of potatoes and snow peas. In the future he hopes to have more land so that he can plant for wholesale and be able to export his products.

The other members of the group work in agriculture.

17 of the group's borrowers appear in the photo, but only 16 are taking out a loan in this cycle.

loans.use: Comprar Fertilizante

loans.name: Flor De Verano Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VERANO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jovana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de toallas, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de jugos, venta de peluches, venta de pantalones, servicio de transporte, venta de medias, venta de CD’s, servicio de secretariado, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jovana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, porque le ayudaba en su negocio desde sus trece años, cuando tuvo su primer hijo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE VERANO” communal bank is in its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Jvana serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include selling towels, clothing sales, food sales, juice sales, stuffed animal sales, pants sales, transportation services, selling socks, CD sales, secretarial services, and fruit sales.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Jovana’s.  She has been with Pro Mujer for three years and joined on the invitation of another member.  She has a fruit selling business and says that she learned this business from her aunt because she used to help her starting when she was three years old.  She decided to set up her own business when she had her first child.
				`
This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and buy fruit from the larger vendors in La Paz and then sell the merchandise in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is in a common law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training on loans and health.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Crescenciano

texts.en:
Crescenciano is a married man from Bien Unido, Bohol and a father of six children. Crescenciano is a fisherman and has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of his income.

Crescenciano is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, including a fishing net, lead weights, hooks, and others. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.
 
Crescenciano hopes to set aside some of his profits so he can continue to send his children to school and purchase a new pump boat in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, including a fishing net, lead weights, hooks, and others.

loans.name: Elivil

texts.en:
Elivil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, seasonings, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Elivil has been in this business for 18 years; she earns more income from pig fattening and buy and sell frozen foods.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and the new loan will further build her business.

Elivil has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like meat, spices, seasonings, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 43 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 29,500 loan from NWTF to buy additional goods to sell to her customers. Delia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, detergent, soap, sugar, canned goods, candies and soft drinks. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 27 años de edad, es un joven que estudio hasta noveno grado, es padre de tres hijos; uno de 6 años y de unas gemelitas de 5 meses de edad, es acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.  

Juan, trabaja como motorista en los moto taxis este trabajo lo ejerce desde hace 4 años, el negocio lo aprendió con el impulso de la suegra que le compro dos moto taxis para que trabajara, él tiene ruta por todo el municipio.

Con el préstamo solicitado en fundación Campo, comprara 10 bolsas de cementó y ladrillo para mejorar la vivienda.  El préstamo mejorara mucho su vida, ya que con este dinero preparara la casa para que sus hijos tengan un buen techo. 

Sus sueños es,  tener su propia empresa de transporte de moto taxis y así poder tener más personas trabajando y obtener más ganancias y más ingresos para su familia y quiere que sus  hijos se preparen mucho.
texts.en:
Juan is a 27-year-old man who studied up to the 9th grade.  He's a father of 3 children, a 6-year-old and 5-month-old twins.  He's accompanied by his wife who takes care of the domestic chores.  

Juan has worked as a driver of motorcycle taxis for the last 4 years.  He learned the business with the help of his mother-in-law who bought him 2 motorcycle taxis so that he could work.  He has routes throughout his municipality.  

With the loan requested at Fundación Campo he will buy 10 bags of cement and bricks to improve his house.  This loan will greatly improve his life because with this money he will prepare his house so that his children can have a good roof over their heads.  

His dream is to have his own transportation business of motorcycle taxis to be able to have more people working and generate more earnings and income for his family.  He wants his children to study a lot.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of cement and bricks to improve his house.

loans.name: Ersultan

texts.en:
Ersultan is a freshman in the Psychology Program. This is his story:

My sister graduated from AUCA, so I know a little more than most freshman about this university. I had opportunities to meet with her friends and people who studied there. I found out that these students are really smart and successful, and really loved to study. Now they are all successful, and I know that I want to follow in their path.

I would like to study psychology to know and understand people's behavior and mental processes. It is interesting for me the way people behave in similar situations, and how they can be influenced by environmental and other conditions. I want to understand what factors help shape and define who we are and find out what motivates the behavior and decisions of individuals. After I graduate I want to be a psychotherapist and my dream is to help people to understand their problems.

Students in AUCA are hardworking and eager to study and to be successful. It is important for me to surround myself with people who have the same desire to study as I have. The other things that I like at AUCA are the extracurricular activities. I like the social and volunteer groups, because volunteers show people how to do good things as well as love and respect the people around them.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 50, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in a nearby town, and earns a respectable income. With the passage of time, inflation has increased, but the income has not. To grow income, he wants to advance his enterprise. He does not have a sufficient amount to purchase more vegetables; he tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives, but nobody helped him. 

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband so he would be able to buy additional vegetables to sell. 

Nasreen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven se casó y ha tenido que trabajara para ayudar con la económica del hogar y apoyar a sus hijos que se superen y tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos comestibles en un quiosco ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo reposterías, frescos, gaseosas, sanwind, churritos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos. El objetivo del crédito es invertiré en capital de trabaja y aprovechar la temporada navideña donde las ventas se incrementan y así en  un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She is married with children who are adults. She is originally from the central area of the country. She distinguishes herself as a responsible worker with a desire for self-improvement. She married very young and has had to work to help with the household expenses, and to support her children so they can improve and have better living conditions.

Thanks to her effort and desire to succeed, she sells foods at a kiosk located in a specific location of the neighborhood. For 12 hours a day she sells pastries, natural beverages, soft drinks, sandwiches, churros, candies, and juices. 

The purpose of the loan is for working capital and to take advantage of the Christmas season when sales increase. That way in the not-too-distant future she can obtain a better income.  María is grateful for the assistance that Kiva investors provide so that people with limited resources and from poorer countries like Nicaragua can have the means for decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business with foods such as pastries, natural beverages, soft drinks, sandwiches, churros, candies, and juices.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to pay for additional gowns and barong tagalog (an embroidered formal shirt from the Philippines) to expand her inventory. More items to sell will result in better profits. She still sells mineral water and the loan will also be useful there. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Regina dreams of having her own stall in the market, so that her gowns will be easily seen.  She hopes that her whole family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional gowns and barong tagalog (an embroidered formal shirt from the Philippines) to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed an 60,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy beverages and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy beverages and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes that her business will run smoothly and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members,* to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a policeman, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aurora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Aurora dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her family will always be in good condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 56 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, sugar, shampoo, candles, bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Rafael, an enterprising man, is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.  He is currently requesting a loan in hopes of buying supplies, such as fertilizers and fumigants.  He wants to maintain his coffee crops so he can keep them in good condition during their development and obtain high quality produce.  This gentleman's only limitation to continued growth is a lack of money, as they depend on this business to be able to get ahead.  This is why he is asking for this loan and it is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken out loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with greater credit facilities and a much lower interest rate….

loans.use: to buy  supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a freshman in the Psychology program. This is his story:

I have always been interested psychology. I have read a lot of books concerning the human psyche and behavior, and found them deeply fascinating. Specifically, it was the work written by Erich Fromm that ignited my aspiration to study psychology.

I believe that there are a lot of prospects for a young psychologist today, because there are always new things being discovered about the human mind and how it works. I would like to work in the future to help people overcome the problems that make their lives more difficult, and help us build a strong society in Kyrgyzstan.

I want to study at the American University of Central Asia because the university is able to provide its students with a high quality education that meets modern standards. Students come from all over the world to study here, and I will be surrounded by people from different cultural backgrounds. I am also glad about the fact that most subjects will be taught in English language. It will give me a remarkable opportunity to enhance my language skills. I can say for certain that the American University of Central Asia is the perfect place to expand my intellectual horizons and achieve great things.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the family's needs. Therefore, Sughra started her own business to contribute to the family's income. 

She has been operating a business selling bangles for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates, and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. 

Sughra has requested a loan to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. 

She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Sughra thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo, Guadalupe esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce y frances por mayor y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 43 years old and has been selling sweet breads and baguettes for many years. She has many clients because she sells a very popular product. With her sales, she wants to solve some home expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and her son. Guadalupe seeks a loan to buy more sweet breads and baguettes to continue her work and help her increase her profits to have a better quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy sweet breads and baguettes for resale

loans.name: Jarelyn

texts.en:
Jarelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 4 years. 

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. In the future, Jarelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bread, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell. Juliet has been in this business for 13 years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, bread, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gregoria is 43 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Lovelyn has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Lovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell tobacco business in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Demia

texts.es: Denia  tiene la edad de 48 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Ella el  crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono, herbicidas para  dar asistencia a una siembra de frijoles que quieren iniciar y a la vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Denia is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son. The loan she is seeking is to buy fertilizer and herbicides and improve the condition of her bean farm she and her husband wish to start and help with labor. Denia wants to look after the plants well so that she gets good production and earns more money.

She hopes to provide her family with a better standard of living in the future and a more stable income. Then she will be able to continue making progress both as a person and a coffee producer.

This is Denia's first loan with FUDECOSUR, nor has she had any with other banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is offering the easiest terms and the lowest interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help grow beans

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 37-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in his nearby community and gets a reasonable income for his family. He purchases milk from wholesalers and sells it as a retailer over his shop. He wants to offer yogurt according to the demand but he does not have money to buy more milk for the production of yogurt.

Therefore, Munira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to purchase more fresh milk for the production of yogurt to sell. Munira hopes that she would be able to make some savings with the amount of profit. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more milk for the production of yogurt to sell.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Doña Cruz es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos ánimos y esperanzas de salir adelante y de cumplir lo propuesto en su vida manifestando a sus 53 años la gratitud y el respeto hacia sus padres por haber inculcado en ella valores, principios que son la base de la superación y prosperidad en la vida. Ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos quienes apoyan a sus padres en las diferentes actividades del campo como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, recolección del grano etc. Desde hace más de 17 años practica la agricultura en compañía de su esposo a quien ella agradece el apoyo incondicional por los muchos años juntos como equipo de trabajo y en su matrimonio. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando aproximadamente a medio kilómetros de distancia. Doña Cruz no tiene ningún grado de educación por lo que hoy en día se esmera y se esfuerza diariamente para que su familia tenga más oportunidades en la vida e incrementar el patrimonio familiar. 
Ella tiene como meta elaborar una pequeña remodelación a su casa de habitación la cual necesita unas mejoras, apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario y demás que ellos necesiten y ella pueda ayudar. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
