Balqees is a 48-year-old married woman.  For the past 5 years, Balqees has been successfully running a milk shop with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo.  Over time, they have become famous in their area for providing good quality milk.  They hold a good client list and make enough money to contribute to Balqees family's income.  

Balqees has some past savings and is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to purchase chairs for her shop as well as utensils such as bowls and bottles.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her shop as well as utensils such as bowls and bottles.

loans.name: Mwanahel

texts.en:
Mwanahel is a widowed woman with 4 children, and describes herself as sincere.  

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, rice, milk and other items, and has been involved in this business for 5 years.  Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy stock.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of sugar, bread, milk and other items.  

Her business goal is to own a bigger retail  shop within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add additional stock of groceries

loans.name: María Elda

texts.es:
María, a sus 50 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado como comerciante independiente, inicialmente tuvo un almacén de variedades y otro de alquiler de vestidos para eventos pero, debido a que fue víctima de una estafa, perdió su vivienda y ambos locales, dejándola prácticamente arruinada económicamente. Sin embargo, motivada por el amor de su familia y, con su empuje y perseverancia, logró sobrepasar los obstáculos y desde hace 12 años se dedica a vender mercancía por catálogo, con el fin de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, productos de aseo personal, entre otros), así podrá prepararse con un inventario más diverso que satisfaga las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, mejorando las ventas en la temporada de navidad.
María manifiesta que su anhelo principal es poder reiniciar un almacén de variedades, que le permita generar mejores ingresos para dar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a los que ama.
texts.en:
Maria, at the age of 50, is married and is the mother of two children. During her working life, she has been an independent businesswoman. First she had a variety store and another location for renting clothing for events, but because she was the victim of a fraud, she lost her home and both shops, leaving her practically ruined economically. Nevertheless, motivated by the love of her family and with her effort and perseverance, she managed to overcome the obstacles and for 12 years she has sold merchandise by catalog, with the goal of generating income to assist her husband with the economic responsibility of the household.

Now she is applying for the assistance of the loan to buy wholesale stock (perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics, and personal toiletries, among other items). Thus she will be able to prepare herself with a more diverse inventory that will satisfy the needs and tastes of her customers, improving her sales in the Christmas season.

Maria declares that her principal goal is to be able to restart her variety store, which would allow her to generate greater income in order to provide better well-being and quality of life to those whom she loves.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics, and personal toiletries, among other items)

loans.name: Manuel Ascencio Padilla Iii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANUEL ASCECIO PADILLA III” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, tejido de chompas, venta de sullus (rituales andinos), venta de comida, taller de cerrajería, artesanía en muñecas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al ayudar a su tía en la elaboración de comida, pasado el tiempo decide emprender un espacio independiente de negocio donde actualmente vende.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, papa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MANUEL ASCECIO PADILLA III” communal bank is in its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Virginia serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include a neighborhood store, fruit sales, sweater knitting, sulles sales (Andean rituals), food sales, locksmith services, and art in dolls.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Virginia’s.  She has been with Pro Mujer for two cycles, having joined on the invitation of another member.  She sells food and says that she learned this business several years ago, by helping her aunt make food.  After some time she decided to set up her own space from where she currently sells her products.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and rice, cooking oil, and potatoes from the large suppliers in El Alto then sell the merchandise in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans, health, and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is a farmer managing his own farm for a living. He has been growing and harvesting bananas for four years, earning enough money for his needs. To improve the farm, he borrowed  a loan from GDMPC to cover the costs of farm fertilization. Allan wants to improve his farm in order to have a better income for his future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm fertilization

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as sincere. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock of groceries. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to add to her stock of groceries. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of groceries.

loans.name: Akida

texts.en:
Akida is a hard-working woman. She is a married parent of four children. Akida has been busy with farming and animal husbandry for more than 18 years. She grows crops and grapes. Akida also feeds small cattle. Akida likes her deal. She works hard from early morning till late at night. Her husband and her daughter help her manage her business. Akida’s husband has his own driving business. 

Akida needs money because her daughter is going to be married.  She is asking for a loan of 2,600 somoni to arrange the wedding party for her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To arrange a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional supplies of chicken and pork meat needed in his business.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs. Ma. Victoria is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Suzette has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Suzette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 50 years old, and he lives in the village Ujanis, which is in the Syunik region. He is not married, and he lives with his retired mother. He has graduated constructional college and received a specialty of house painter. For several years, he worked at different companies and construction sites. Now, he is very seriously engaged in beekeeping. During a year, he manages to sell a lot of honey that is pure, tasty, very healthful and healing. In his region, Ara is a very famous and skilled beekeeper.

He asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy frames, hives and a honey-squeezing machine.

loans.use: to buy frames, beehives and a honey-squeezing machine

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 45-year-old married woman. For many years, she has run a beauty parlor where she offers many services to her customers, such as make-up, hairstyling, and facials. Razia has become very famous in her street for providing her best services. Her husband runs a tailoring shop at home as well. 

Razia is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for her beauty parlor, to meet increasing customer demand, and an overlock machine for her husband, but she does not have enough cash in hand. Razia is requesting a loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities and an overlock machine for her husband’s tailoring business. She hopes to cater to more customers in time. Razia is very experienced in her business and confident that her loan will help her to expand.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products for her beauty parlor and an overlock machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS OBRERAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de CD’s, venta de ollas, venta de calzados, tejido de mantillas y chambras, venta de busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al adquirir una máquina de coser, posteriormente a aprender la técnica de elaboración de calzados decide implementarlo independiente mente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y realiza el trabajo para apoyar a su madre económicamente.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “HORMIGUITAS OBRERAS” communal bank is in its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Lourdes serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include bed sales, a neighborhood store, clothing sales, CD sales, cooking pot sales, shoe sales, blanket and camisole knitting, and sweat suit sales.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Lourdes’.  She has been with Pro Mujer for a year and joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She sells shoes and says that she learned this business after acquiring a sewing machine.  After she learned how to make shoes she set up her business.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and buy leather from the large suppliers in El Alto then make and sell her products in her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her household.  She is single and works to support her mother financially

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in loans and health.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is from Vardavank village of Kapan region. She is a teacher at a local village school and lives with her husband and two children. Svetlana's elder daughter (in the photo) studies at Goris State University and she both studies and works at school with her mother.

The whole family works hard to cover their basic costs and sustain their living. Because of current financial difficulties that the family faces, Svetlana is unable to pay for her daughter's university costs. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition and give her an opportunity to continue her studies there.

Svetlana and her family are very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, Shota, and two sons in the Samtredia district. Her sons go to the local school. 

Khatuna works at a local supermarket as a saleslady and generates 200 GEL (Georgia lari) per month. Shota gets orders to renovate houses, and his salary depends on orders. The income is not enough for a four-member family. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start her own business with the loan. Khatuna’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

Khatuna plans to rent the supermarket where she already works. She will pay for the rent and also purchase stock to fill the supermarket. Khatuna will offer wide assortments of products to her clients, and thus, her income will increase. She will expand her business with increased income in future. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to rent a supermarket and purchase stock to fill it

loans.name: Hamza Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hamza. It consists of four members who are all females. All of them are friends from Sana`a, Yemen. They have primarily worked together in a small business selling varieties of goods for several years. The entire group took a loan of 130,000 Yemen Rials (YER). 

Hadia is 23 years old. She has been running a retail shop by selling food products. Her main goal is to attain steady growth and to be recognized as a seller of high-quality products. Her main goals are to gain customers that order in greater quantities and to have enough capital to respond to potentially increasing demand. She has an old fridge which is not running well for her business; this is why she asks for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a new fridge to use for her business. She wants the range of goods she offers to make an impression on her customers, which will help her sell more.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge to use for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hose pipes.

loans.name: M. Ashiq

texts.en:
M. Ashiq is 26 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store near his house for five years and the business is operating very well. In this way he is feeding his old parents and sibling. He established the store with the help of a previous loan from BRAC. His shop is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers here to buy miscellaneous general store items. 

M. Ashiq wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable for daily use. He wants to offer stationery items such as copies, pencils, pens, pencil lead, erasers, etc. But the major problem is the shortage of funds. Therefore, M. Ashiq requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, and flour and additional stationery items. He was very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

M. Ashiq is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour and additional stationery items for his store

loans.name: Segundo Desiderio

texts.es:
Segundo vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, trabaja como operario en una pequeña fábrica de calzado de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante cada día. 

Segundo agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una laptop, para poder realizar sus propios diseños de calzado y poder trabajar de mejor manera, de esta manera el podrá seguir esforzándose para seguir luchando y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propia fábrica de confección de zapatos”.
texts.en:
Segundo lives in the city of Chiclayo and works for a small shoe factory in his town, where he earns a daily income.

Segundo is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide the assistance he needs to buy a laptop computer so he can create his own shoe designs and enable him to continue making his dream a reality, “Having his own show factory.”

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Zhasmela

texts.en:
Zhasmela is from Hovq village. She lives there with her husband and three children. Zhasmela and her husband are involved in agriculture. They run a small but beautiful farm which includes livestock and a plot of land where different types of fruit trees are grown (plum, nut, and pear).

Zhasmela's husband takes the gathered harvest to a nearby market and sells it there. The main source of income for this family comes from agriculture, so Zhasmela works hard to gather a good harvest. 

She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Zhasmela's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

The loan will greatly assist Zhasmela's agribusiness and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock (soft drinks, beers, snacks, fried foods, and sweets, among other items) wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 40 years old and a hard-working man who started from nothing, but has managed to maintain a spare parts shop and educate his children. He started with little income, and he applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He deals in spare parts in Rwashamaire town. 

He has a challenge of limited income to expand his business, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy more stocks of spare parts hoping that it will serve his clients better and increase his profits. In the photo, he is the client with the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself as a faithful person.

For the past five years Peninah has sold groceries in a densely populated area. She says her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of money to build up her stock of groceries.

This will be Peninah’s first loan through SMEP DTM. She is applying for 20,000 KES to buy extra groceries to sell. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years and hopes that her future will be a successful one.

loans.use: to buy extra groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is single with four children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She sells maize brand (the leftovers of milled maize) at the market. She has been in this business for the many years. She operates her business on a wholesale and retail basis. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of maize brand, poultry feed and vaccines. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to get a plot of land for growing maize and to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize brand, poultry feed and vaccines

loans.name: Zaenal

texts.en: Zaenal runs a small stall that sells groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about two or three hours from Jakarta. Zaenal is married and has two children. He began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business. For the last month, he has had around $14 to $15 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took out a loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends when sales are usually higher than on weekdays. In the photo, Zaenal is standing in front of his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to have working capital to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Santos German

texts.es:
Santo de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3º grado de escolaridad; desde corta edad decidió dedicarse a la pesca  artesanal. Actualmente,  está acompañado y vive junto a su esposa y 3 hijos. Sus hijos actualmente estudian. Dentro de su familia es el único que desarrolla una actividad económica.

En cuanto a su experiencia como pescador; esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 20 años, aprendió todo sobre la pesca de familiares que se dedicaban a lo mismo y poco a poco fue perfeccionando la técnica. Sus horas de trabajo generalmente son  nocturnas.

Hace un mes atrás, compro una lancha (mas nueva que la que tiene y más grande); no obstante quedo debiendo al vendedor $500.00 los cuales pretende que Fundación Campo,  le preste para terminar de pagar  la deuda. Con un mejor equipo tendrá mayores ganancias.

Al consultarle sobre sus aspiraciones, comento que desea que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para poder hacerle frente a la vida. También,  sueña con poder tener una casa propia, ya que donde vive es alquila.
texts.en:
Santo is 34 years old, has a third grade education and started fishing from a young age.  He is married and has three children who attend school.  He is the only one who supports the family.

He has been doing this for 20 years and learned everything from his family who does this as well and he perfected his technique little by little.  He generally works at night.

A month ago he bought a boat (newer and larger than the one he has); however he still owes $500 and is asking for a loan through Fundación Campo which will allow him to pay this debt.  With better equipment he will have greater income.

When asked about his aspirations, he said that he wanted his children to attend school and prepare themselves to face life.  He also dreams of having a home of his own; he currently rents.

loans.use: to pay for a boat.

loans.name: Mirisiari

texts.en: Marisiari is a repeat borrower. He is 45 years old and a resident of a rural area in Rutunguru, Ihunga, Ntungamo district. He is a married man with six children and he is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. He deals in charcoal making and in agriculture. The purpose of the loan is to buy trees that he will burn to make charcoal. He hopes he will be able to make more bags of charcoal and sell them at a higher price to the people who come from the city. This will improve his well-being and pay tuition for his children who are in school. He thanks UGAFODE for partnering with him. He is pictured with the credit officer of UGAFODE (from right to left).

loans.use: To buy trees that he will burn to make charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a 69-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small parcel of land where she grows rice to earn a living. She is also in the business of selling Khmer cake in a local market in her community, earning a profit of USD 5.66 per day. She usually uses her income for meals, allowance for her school-going children and other living costs.

To help her with her farming, Thea is asking for a loan to buy two cows for the maintenance of her rice fields. She has been client of HKL for one loan already and has successfully paid it off. 

With the increase in her profits, Thea hopes to improve her plantation and financially support her family and her children.

loans.use: to buy two cows for the maintenance of her rice fields.

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Shida, who is in her early thirties, is married and has three children. Two of them are in school. For 10 years now, Shida has been running a food stall business: Mamalishe. She works from 6am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is Shida's 10th loan request from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay for raw ingredients like cooking oil, beans, bananas, cooking water, rice, maize, baking flour and other related items. Shida has managed all of her previous loans well which made her business grow. With her profit, she built a house, and covered part of home and school expenses. She will use this loan to pay for ingredients like maize, baking flour, rice, beans, bananas and meat. She dreams to build a house that has a room for her business. 

Shida will share this loan with her loan group Mikoroshini which has nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients like maize, baking flour, rice, beans, bananas and meat.

loans.name: Nkuba

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Nkuba est une étudiante en deuxième année de graduat dans une institution universitaire au département de Management et Administration. Elle fut informée de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation supérieure qu’offre l’IMF Hekima aux étudiantes. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt leur servira de payer les frais académiques durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Cette étudiante construit un grand rêve et se voir devenir chef d’entreprise, Analyste financier, etc. Au finish, elle salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de post conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mademoiselle Nkuba is a student in the second year of her graduate studies in the Management and Administration Department of a university. She was informed that IMF Hekima was offering new opportunities for higher education loans. This new loan will help her pay academic fees throughout the 2013-2014 academic year. 

This student is building a big dream and sees her family producing a computer engineer, a doctor, the head of a company, analyst etc. At the end, she would like to give a large thank you to Hekima for their special initiative - especially this social impact project - during this period of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: pay for schooling.

loans.name: Yuma

texts.fr: Le client Yuma est un agent  d’une compagnie d’énergie et électricité. Parent de 8 étudiants et élèves inscrits étudient régulièrement à l’université et école secondaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours  durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve voir ses enfants devenir des ingénieurs agronome, électromécanicien, informaticien, médecin, chef d’entreprise, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Yuma is an agent for an energy and electricity company. He's the father of eight children who study at the university or attend middle school.

He got informed of the new education loan opportunity offered by Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. He will thus use this new loan to pay his children's school expenses, so that they are no longer excluded from lectures during the academic year 2013-2014.  

This father dreams of seeing his children become farm engineers, electro-mecanicians, computer scientists, doctors, company managers, etc.

In the end, he hails Hekima's special initiative and, especially, this project with big social impact, during this post-war time in the east of the country.

loans.use: to pay his children's school expenses

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail business where he sells groceries. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a highly populated area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock of groceries. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to his stock of groceries. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of groceries

loans.name: Zokir

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере Зокира  занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания. Более 31 лет Зокир занимается выращиванием лука и пшеницы. Ему 53 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Зокир должен провести мероприятие в семье, но не имеет денег. Зокир запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Land is one of the primary sources of business and primary provider in Tajikistan.  Many people, just like Zokir, are involved in farming and earn a living.  Zokir has been involved in growing onions and wheat for over 31 years.  He is 53 years old.  He is married and raising 3 children.  Zokir has to hold a ceremony in the family, but does not have money.  Zokir is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to hold this ceremony.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a family ceremony

loans.name: Chinquillas Group

texts.es: Ruben, tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos con su esposa y reside en el municipio de Colinas, Santa Barbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en la producción de granos básicos. Lleva dos años de cultivar plátano, el cual lo vende en la zona o a intermediarios. Ruben decidió solicitar un préstamo en forma grupal que es por  20,000 lempiras, con el fin de comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de plátano y para sembrar 1/2 manzana de terreno mas de plátano. Con la fertilización que haga el cultivo va mejorar la producción. Sus metas son aumentar la producción, sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia. El grupo  se llama Chinquillas, que lo forman dos personas, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura y cultivo de plátano. El préstamo grupal es por 30,000 Lempiras y lo utilizaran para fertilizar  el cultivo de plátano. En la foto se identifica Ruben quien esta con camiseta a la derecha y don Mario con sombrero a la izquierda.
texts.en:
Ruben is 44 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the town of Colinas, Santa Barbara.  He has always been a farmer of basic grains and has been raising bananas, for two years, which he sells in his local area or to wholesalers.  Ruben decided to request a group loan in the amount of 20,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer for his bananas and to plant half an acre of land.  By applying the fertilizer he will have a better crop and he will increase his income and quality of life for his family.

The group is called Chinquillas and is made up of people from the same community who all raise bananas.  Ruben appears to the right of the photo, wearing a t-shirt, and Mario is to the left and wearing a hat.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, milk, and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rachel Lea

texts.fr: Rachel est une jeune femme de 26 ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants de 3 et  5 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale ou elle a  ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle fait un petit commerce général à savoir: produits de première nécessité et produits de beauté. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock des produits de beauté. Ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dan son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Rachel is a young 26-year-old woman who is single and the mother of 2 children aged 3 and 5. She is a retailer at a market located in the capital, where she has opened a shop selling essential goods and beauty products. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her inventory of beauty products. This will increase not only her sales, but also her profit margin. Part of this profit will be invested in the expansion of her business, and the rest will enable her to meet her small family's needs.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Santa Gricelda

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene  73 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo ya no trabaja por motivos de la edad.
Doña Santa para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en Guayaquil cuando puede. Tiene más de 15  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen Del Mar" (Our Lady of the Sea) meets every 15 days in the beautiful seaside community of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Most of the residents in this place are devoted to fishing or other jobs related to the sea. 

Sra. Santa lives in this place.  She is 73 years old, married, and has eight grown children.  Three of them still live at her house.  Her husband is no longer working because of his age.  

Doña Santa earns her own income and helps with the household expenses by selling clothing of all types.  Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door, but she also sells to customers who come to her house in order to buy merchandise.  Santa works every day, extends credit to her customers, and collects payment in two installments.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or in Guayaquil whenever she can.  Santa has been in this business for more than 15 years and the income she has earned has helped her get ahead.  

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.  Santa has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because her first loan was used to start her business.  Her dreams include being in good health.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells groceries. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy groceries. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his stock of groceries. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of groceries

loans.name: Maria Santana

texts.es: Maria se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, shampoo, etc. el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias de donde reside ya tiene clientela fija que la prefieren por la calidad de los productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, Maria desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria sells all types of personal use products, such as colognes, deodorants, creams, perfumes, shampoo, etc. out of her home business.  She also sells on foot through different neighborhoods and has steady customers because of the quality of her products and good prices.  She uses her earnings to help her husband pay the household expenses.  They own their home and Maria wants to grow her business, so she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs to obtain a greater income and have better financial stability with her family, since this is her only source of work.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Hilda Leticia

texts.es: Hilda de 35 años de edad vive  encasa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella desde hace 9 años posee un negocio ubicado en su lugar de residencia donde comercializa zapatos y ropa, posee mucha clientela por la buena calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Hilda esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y surtir aun mas su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilda is 35 years old and lives in a home of her own with her family, including her husband and two children.  She has been selling clothing and shoes out of her house for nine years, and has many customers because of the good quality of her products and good prices.  She helps her husband with the household expenses with what she earns and they are able to get ahead.

Hilda is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy more merchandise in quantity, and restock her business, since this is her source of work, and this allows her to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Nargizi

texts.en: Nargizi is a 37-year-old married woman from the village of Naruja. She lives with her husband, two school-aged sons, her father-in-law and mother-in-law. The last ones are getting a pension from the local government. Nargizi's husband is unemployed nowadays and both are involved in agricultural activities. They take care of cattle and also cultivate nuts. The agricultural products are sold locally and the monthly income from this activity is 330 GEL. For further development of her agricultural activities Nargizi wants to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and start trading. She requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved under the Start up program, that takes a chance on people starting or restarting businesses. This loan will help Nargizi to expand her business and generate more income for her family's stable financial condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and start trading.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 59 ans, veuve mère de 6 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 24 et 38 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'elle gère elle même depuis 03 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totalement d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock  et d'emménager aussi son local. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie is a 59-year-old widow and mother to six children between the ages of 24 and 38. She is a shopkeeper who opened a small grocery store, which she has run single-handedly for the past three years. It is thanks to her hard work that she has been able to meet her family's needs. Thanks to her warm personality and her neighbourly attitude, she has amassed a loyal customer base, which she built up over time. Right now, she is no longer able to totally satisfy this customer base, which is where the need for this loan arises. This loan will allow her to increase her grocery stock and to refurbish her premises. This will increase her sales and thereby her profit margins. These profits will be partially reinvested into her business in order to expand it and the rest will allow her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her grocery stock and to refurbish her premises

loans.name: Leyla

texts.ru: Лейле 52 года, вдова, одна воспитала 3 детей. Супруг умер от тяжелой болезни и Лейла сама поднимает детей. Старший сын -пастух, пасет скот местного населения за определенную плату. Второй сын находится на заработках в Казахстане, дочь учится в техникуме. У Лейлы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Лейла занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Лейлы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,60 ГА, на котором выращивает клевер, фасоль и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Лейла обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом  на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Лейла планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Leyla is 52 years old, a widow and raised 3 children alone. Her husband died from an illness, and Leyla raised the children by herself.  The oldest son is a shepherd and takes local residents' livestock to pasture for a set payment.  The second son works in Kazakhstan, and the daughter attends a technical college.  Leyla has a secondary education, and to provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 28 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Leyla's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 heifer, 5 sheep and also a 3.60 hectare land plot, where she grows clover, beans and barley. The monthly income amounts to 16,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Leyla requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a high price. Leyla plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her son's wedding party.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith de 28 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos (7 años y 4 años de edad), madre y  un  hermano. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Con mucho esfuerzo hace algunos años logró establecer una pequeña pupuseria la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Par ella lo más importante es que sus hijos cuenten con las mejores condiciones de vida y  hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darles lo necesario. Edith solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso de la vivienda ya que se ha deteriorado y desea repararlo. Con el monto demandado comparará cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso.
texts.en: Edith is a 28-year-old single mother and lives in her own home with her two children (ages 7 and 4), her mother and her brother. Edith is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. With a lot of effort she was able to establish a small pupusa (stuffed tortillas) stand some years ago, and it has been her main source of income. For Edith, the most important thing is for her children to have the best living conditions, and she does everything in her power to give them what they need. Edith is requesting the loan to repair the floor of her home, which has deteriorated and needs to be fixed. She plans to purchase cement, sand and bricks for the floor.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and bricks to repair the floor of her home.

loans.name: Santos Matilde

texts.es: Santos es una mujer trabajadora reconocida por su emprendedurismo y entrega en el trabajo. Ella se dedica  a la venta de semillas de marañón desde hace tres años. Junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar y dan a sus hijos (uno de 12 años, otro 10 años) el sustento diario. Con mucho esfuerzo han logrado construir su vivienda la cual aún le hace falta el corredor, razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor de la vivienda y el encementado del piso. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso, lámina galvanizada y además, comprará una ventana para dar seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en: Santos is a hardworking woman known for her entrepreneurship and work ethic. She has made a living selling cashews for three years. She and her husband manage the household finances and feed their two children (ages 12 and 10). With a lot of hard work they were able to build their home, which is still missing a hallway. Santos is requesting a loan to invest in the construction of the home's hallway and to cement the floors. With the money, she plans to purchase cement, sand, flooring bricks, zinc sheeting and a window to make the home more secure.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, flooring bricks, zinc sheeting and a window.

loans.name: Mariam Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kavanga est une commerçante d’une expérience de 4 ans, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 8 enfants, tous étudient. La cliente est présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Mariam ». Elle est vendeuse de divers habits. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché mouvementé de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie et autres habits de prestige.  Son conjoint,lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The borrower, Kavanga, is a retailer with a four-year experience in her field.  She is 40 years old and the mother of eight children who all go to school.  She is a member and the leader of a business association called "Mariamu".  She sells various types of clothes, displaying her goods at her town's busy market.  She is taking a loan from Hekima in order to increase her activity.  She will buy one bale of used clothing as well as other pricier clothes.  Kavanga's husband also works in retail. Kavanga started her own business with some money received from her husband.  In the future, she would like to increase her capital, feed her children, buy them clothes and pay for their education.  She thanks Hekima for the support it provides to women with no access to the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans during this post-conflict period in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing and other pricier clothes.

loans.name: Mehronby

texts.en:
Mehronby is 54 years old. She is a glorious woman. Mehronby is married and has four children. Her children are adults. Her husband works in a state organization. Mehronby does not have higher education. She began her own business, growing agricultural products, five years ago. 

Mehronby grows vegetables, such as potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber, onion and etc. She has her own land. Mehronby works hard from early morning every day because she wants to get a good harvest and sell it to local people. 

She is going to sow, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru: Насибахон родом из района Кубадиён. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей. Старший сын в России на заработках, а остальные дети еще маленькие и учатся в школе. Насибахон на протяжении двух лет занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Она вместе с мужем ходит по селам и деревням, оптом покупает миндаль у дехкан и затем привозит домой. Вся семья помогает ей в деле. Они сортируют миндаль по сортам и затем с наценкой продают на рынках района. Это их семейный бизнес. В данный момент Насибахон просит кредит, чтобы закупить партию миндаля для перепродажи. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Nasibakhon is from Kubad. She is 43. She is married and has four children. Her eldest son is working in Russia, and the other children are still young and in school. Nasibakhon has been buying and selling almonds for two years. She, along with her husband, goes to villages and buys almonds wholesale from farmers and then brings them home. The whole family then helps her. They sort the almonds into grades and then sell them for a profit at the market. This is their family business. Currently Nasibakhon is requesting a loan to buy almonds for resale. She is waiting for support.

loans.use: buy almonds for resale

loans.name: Nazoratkhon

texts.ru: Назоратхон родом из города Исфара. Она 43-летняя замужняя женщина с тремя детьми. Сыну 21 год, а дочерям по 18 и 10 лет. Назоратхон имеет торговый бизнес. Ее магазин расположен рядом с центральной больницей. Она продает там женские теплые халаты, ночные одежды, а также полотенце и т.д. Назоратхон занимается данным бизнесом на протяжении 18 лет. Ее муж мастер строитель. Старший сын уехал на заработки в Россию, а дочери учатся. Назоратхон  трудолюбивая, усердная женщина. Она работает в своем магазине с утра до вечера, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите для развития своего бизнеса. Она собирается закупить ассортимент товара и для этого просит кредит. Она ждет и надеется на финансовую помощь.
texts.en: Nazoratkhon is from the city of Isfara.  She is a 43-year-old married woman with three children.  Her son is 21 years old, and daughters are 18 and 10 years old.  Nazoratkhon has a retail outlet.  Her store is located near the central hospital.  She sells women's warm robes, sleepwear and also towels and etc. there.  Nazoratkhon has been involved in this business for 18 years.  Her husband is a construction worker.  The oldest son left to work in Russia, and the daughters are studying.  Nazoratkhon is a hardworking and diligent woman.  She works at her store from morning to night in order to provide for his family.  Now she needs a loan to develop her business.  She is planning to purchase a selection of merchandise and is requesting a loan for this.  She is awaiting and hoping for financial help.

loans.use: to purchase women's warm robes, sleepwear and towels

loans.name: Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has been blessed with a son who is in school. She is currently in her early 30s. Since 2003, Rose has been managing a poultry business (broiler chickens). She starts her business early at 6:00 am until 07:00 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her ninth loan request, which she will use to buy chicks for her business. Rose expects to buy more chicks in the coming months so as to make her business grow and manage her expenses. She used her previous loans to maintain her number of chicks and bought the chicks food. Rose is a good customer of Tujijenge who has paid all of her previous loans successfully. With her business profit, she built a house to rent. Rose covered part of her family's food expenses and school fees. She dreams of improving her rental house more.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Green Tomalin" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Generosite B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamate est une brave commerçante, trésorière et membre d’une plate forme d’affaires «Générosité B», senior entrepreneur,dynamique, âgée de 34 ans, responsable et mère de 3 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits de meilleure qualité (pagnes super wax). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de sa mère biologique et qui fut aussi son initiatrice. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 45 pièces de pagnes. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite devenir grossiste, acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kamate, age 34, is a brave merchant and a member and the treasurer of Générosité B Group. She's energetic and an experienced senior entrepreneur. She's the mother and caretaker of three children, who all go to school.

Kamate sells superior clothing (Super Wax "pagnes", a kind of colorful African cloth). She displays her products at the busy market in her town. She started her business with support from her biological mother, who also trained her.

Later on, she got a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running her business for 10 years. This new loan will be used to buy 45 pieces of pagnes. In the future, she wishes to become a wholesaler, buy a land lot to build a house, and feed her children and send them to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially at this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy 45 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 41 years old. She is married with four children. All of her children attend school. 

She sells bananas and has spent seven years in the business. She has requested a loan to buy more bananas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 27 years old and married to a businessman. She sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for two years. Immaculee has recently shifted from selling shoes to sell foodstufs. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more potatoes, sugar, and rice for sale. With the profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is from Armavir, where she lives together with her 3-year-old son. For about a year, Anna has been running a small store where she trades with food products. 

Due to a kind attitude toward people, Alla was able to gain customers in Armavir town. Now, as the business is new, Alla needs to fill the store with new products. 

So, she has applied for this loan to purchase products needed for the store. 

Alla had already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Alla was able to open a new store, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Alla to have a successful business and gather more income for her son.

loans.use: to pay for food products needed to sell in the store

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Malishka village. He lives there with his wife and 14-year-old son. 

Samvel is a farmer with 30 years of experience. He runs a farm which includes livestock: chickens, turkeys, cows and calves. Near the village where they live, Samvel also owns arable land where he grows nuts, apples and pear trees. Samvel sells the gathered harvest in a nearby open market and earns income which is vital for his family's living. As there are no job opportunities in the village, locals here are mainly involved in agriculture. So for Samvel, this is also the main source of income and he works hard to gather a good harvest.

Now for applying for this loan, Samvel is asking for financial support to be able to renovate his greenhouse and enlarge the cultivation process.  Samvel has already taken out a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of hard financial conditions wasn't able to pay it back on time. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, he was able to run his farming in a way that it ensures stable financial income during the month. So, Samvel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Samvel and his family to overcome financial difficulties and continue expanding their farm.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Nazaire

texts.fr: Nazaire est un homme de 48 ans, père de famille. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis 9 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Nazaire is a 48-year-old family man. He is a shopkeeper who opened a small grocery store, which he has run single-handedly for the past nine years. It is thanks to his hard work that he has been able to meet his family's needs. Thanks to his warm personality and his neighbourly attitude, he has amassed a loyal customer base, which he built up over time. Right now, he is no longer able to totally satisfy this customer base, which is where the need for this loan arises. This loan will allow him to increase his stock of high-necessity products and to refurbish his premises. This will increase his sales and thereby his profit margins. These profits will be partially reinvested into his business in order to expand it and the rest will allow him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of high-necessity products

loans.name: Prel

texts.en:
Prel wants to buy a dairy cow. For the past six years he has been running his own livestock activity. The cows seen far in the background of this photo are his own cows grazing on his land. Kindly note that Prel did not want to have a close-up photograph of himself. 

He sells raw milk to the market of a nearby town. In addition to the livestock he creates handcrafted wooden items that he then sells at the market. “I love making craft. It requires extreme patience and talent. Althought I do not generate a good income from it, I love it,” is what Prel said to the loan officer during his interview. 

Prel is married and has an 18-year-old child who goes to public school.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 27 years old. She is married with three children. She has been selling both soft drinks and beer for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more food for the family and make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more food for the family and make more savings

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
Нафиса умелая швея. Она шьёт прекрасные национальные платья для женщин. Нафиса швея с детство. У неё талант к этому мастерству. В юношеском возрасте ходила на ученики к швейному мастеру. Там же она научилась всем тонкостям своего дела. Когда Нафиса создала семью и родила двоих детей нужда в дополнительных средствах увеличилось и она решила самостоятельно открыть свое дело. В этом деле её поддержал муж. Ведь и ему тоже не безразличен завтрашний день своей семьи. 
Поначалу Нафиса пользовалась старой швейной машинкой. Но потом решила приобрести  новую собственную швейную машинку и она приобрела швейную машинку «Ямата». В связи с высокой конкурентности  и увеличение потребности семьи в дополнительных средствах Нафиса хочет купить вышивальную машинку. Этим она и её «маленький бизнес» смогут «выжить» и продолжат обслужить большее количество клиентов зарабатывая нужную сумму на образование детей и благополучие своей семьи.
 Она очень надеется, что приобретённый кредит поможет ей не остаться на половине пути и перешагнуть этот трудный момент. Заранее благодарит  МДО «Арванд» за содействие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Nafisa is a skilled seamstress. She sews fantastic national dresses for women. Nafisa has sewn since childhood. She has a talent for this. At a young age, she was an apprentice to a seamstress. There she learnt all details of this activity. 

When Nafisa started a family and gave birth to two children, the need for additional funds increased and she decided to open her own business. Her husband supported her in this business. After all, he is not indifferent to his family's future. In the beginning, Nafisa used an old sewing machine. Then she decided to purchase a new sewing machine and she purchased one of the brand "Yamata". 

Due to high competition and the family's increasing need for additional money, Nafisa would like to purchase an embroidery machine. With this, she and her small business will be able to "survive", and continue to service more customers, earning the necessary amount for the children's education and the family's well-being. 

Nafisa very much hopes that the credit received will help her to move beyond this difficult time. She thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the assistance and support.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is a 32-year-old experienced farmer from the village of Tskhratskaro. He lives with his parents, wife and two children. His parents both get monthly assistance from the local government.  Mamuka's wife works as a cleaner and generates 200 GEL monthly.  Mamuka has been involved in agricultural activities for 16 years already. He takes care of two cattle, 1 pig and a vineyard, that has 0.5 hectare developed.  Mamuka can't get ahead of all the financial difficulties with the help of this mentioned income. He has a great desire to improve his family's living conditions and requested a loan. His loan was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start up program that enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. He needs 4,000 GEL to purchase stock of different home products to open a general store near his house. This loan will be a huge support for this hard-working man and his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase stock of different home products and open a general store

loans.name: Abahiriwe Cb Group

texts.en:
Abahiriwe means “The Blessed” in English.

Francine, 45, is married and for the past six years has sold goats. She is also this group’s leader. She states, “All group members have different business types, but they have come together as a way of organizing themselves for the better. All of the group members have same vision of transforming their lives.”

As leader, Francine is applying for a 2,280,000 RWF through Urwego on behalf of the group. The loan will be apportioned out to the group members. With her portion Francine intends to buy more goats to sell. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Mirvete

texts.en:
A hardworking and friendly thirty-six-year-old, Mirvete is a very polite woman who tries to work hard. She has been operating a business as a seamstress for nearly 10 years, making traditional clothes and selling them to customers who custom order them, and also sometimes in the market to local customers.

Mirvete has a modest workshop in her home where she tends to all of her customers in a friendly and polite manner. Customers leave satisfied with the good work that she does. She likes her business as it allows her to demonstrate her creativity in each clothing item. She also likes that the income she makes from her work allows her to support her family. This is extremely helpful because her husband earns a small amount of money from his employment as a guard for a construction company. Together she and her husband have three children between the ages of two and eight, and they live together in an old house they own in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. 

Mirvete has been sustaining her business through her own efforts all of these years, but now she is applying for a loan in the amount of 500 Euros. She will use this money to buy materials for her business such as fabric, elastic, buttons and more. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future. She is happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business such as fabric, elastic, buttons and more

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alejandro con su crédito anterior en la compra de insumos con los cuales elaboró desinfectantes; con au crédito anterior  pudo redireccionar su negocio con desinfectantes y conseguir nuevos clientes al tener mayor variedad de productos. Ahora es mas reconocido, lo que ha permitido que sus ingresos se incrmenten y que su calidad de vida mejore.Alejandro encia el siguiente mensjae a los finaciadores de Kiva: " Agradezco a las personas de Kiva por haberme brindado la oportunidad de reactivar mi negocio". En la actualidad él, está aplicando a un nuevo finacimeinto, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina, articulos de miscelanea en compañia de su suegra que tiene un punto comercial donde tambien exhibe los productos de uso doméstico que Alejandro vende. Inversión que muy seguramente aumentará su potencialidad de exito, en el mercado al cual le apunta.
texts.en: Thanks to your support, Alejandro was able to purchase supplies to make disinfectants with his previous loan. He was able to redirect his disinfectant business and take on new clients with a wider variety of products. Now he is better known, which has helped him increase his income and improve his quality of life. Alejandro sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "I thank the people of Kiva for having provided me the opportunity to rejuvenate my business." Currently Alejandro is requesting a new loan, through which he plans to purchase a display case and miscellaneous items in company with his mother-in-law, who has a sales post where she can exhibit the household products Alejandro sells. This investment will almost certainly improve his chances for success.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг 38-летняя швея из района Варзоб. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Пять лет тому назад Садбарг открыла свое швейное дело. Она знает профессию швеи еще с юного возраста. Ее мать была швеей и научила дочь своему ремеслу. Садбарг очень нравится шить и придумывать разные фасоны для платьев. К каждому своему заказу она относится серьезно и получает удовольствие от результата работы. Садбарг собирается расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку. Благодаря этой машинке процесс ее работы будет быстрее и качественнее.
texts.en: Sadbarg is a 38-year-old seamstress from the Varzob district.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Sadbarg opened her own sewing business five years old.  She has known the seamstress occupation since a young age.  Her mother was a seamstress and taught her daughter her trade.  Sadbarg likes to sew and come up with different dress designs very much.  She treats every one of her orders seriously and get satisfaction from the results of her work.  Sadbarg is planning to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a modern computerized sewing machine.  Thanks to this machine, her work process will be faster and with more quality.

loans.use: to purchase a modern computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 44 years old and married. He and his wife have been blessed with three children and he supports six members of the family. He is a dairy farmer and has been in business for five years. Right now, his monthly income from the business is 8,000 KES.

He is borrowing a loan of 60,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase a local feed mixer for his dairy farming. He will use the anticipated profit to construct a biogas plant. 

This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan. He hopes to become an Ayrshire breeder.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed equipment.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen used the previous loan to buy a motor cycle for transport business. He is a 40-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and buy a car. He has been in transport for the last five years and his main hardship is the high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of owning at least  five motorcycles and hiring employees to help expand his business.Stephen is requesting for a loan to buy a third motorcycle, which he will hire out to a rider who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy a third motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 45-year-old married father of two from Thika; he has a business as a mixed crop farmer. Richard also runs a grocery store, a business that supplements his income. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

With the loan he has applied from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase a bull and buy more groceries for his grocery store.  The additional income created will allow him to expand on the farm land and pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, Richard would like to offer his children a quality education and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and buy more groceries for his grocery store

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is a 41-year-old married man. He has three children aged three to 10 years old. Cornelius describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business selling shoes and socks. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

His business is located in a conducive environment, and he sells primarily to small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as low returns. He will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a stock of shoes for resale. 

His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that he will be prosperous  in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP--Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. He will use the anticipated profits to buy farm inputs to start farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: buy a stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 57-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 16 to 24 years. He describes himself to be determined.

He operates a welding store where he makes metallic doors, chairs, tables, etc. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

He will use the 10,000 KES  loan to buy metal bars and metal sheets for making chairs, tables, etc. He hopes that in the future he will be able to create employment for the youth. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to increase his stock of metal.

loans.use: to buy metal bars and metal sheets for making chairs and tables

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 29 years old, married, and has been blessed with children between one and five years old. He supports ten people. He runs a food place, a business he has operated for the past one year. His monthly income from the business is KES. 15,000.

Bernard is borrowing a loan of KES. 50,000 which he intends to use to expand his business by buying a weighing machine. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children to improve the living standards of his family and to expand his business by creating employment opportunities. 	

This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to open more branches to provide food services to the people.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine for his food business

loans.name: St Jane  Francis Group

texts.en: Susan is a 49-year-old single mother of three children living in Kasese,Uganda. She is involved in a number of activities such as farming, brick laying and also earns a salary as a civil servant. She has been in the brick laying business for ten years. She started the business in order to raise money to pay school fees for her children. Prolonged rains and limited capital affect her business growth while her dreams are to set up a brick making factory and also expand her farming activities, Susan is requesting for a loan to buy land for farming. She a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and has been in business since 2009. A good father that he is he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications and set up other income generating activities to secure their future. Inadequate capital and high license fees pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. William intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school, and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has been selling cows and goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.name: Boston Elshadai Devt Group
